translated: What are the five?

original: ngo bo nyid dang / byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / gzhi dang / tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid dang / byed pa dang / bsam pa dang / gzhi dang / tshogs pa'o //
translated: Nature, action, intention, basis, and group.

original: de la pham pa ni ltung ba chen po yin no //
analyzed: de la pham pa ni ltung ba chen po yin no //
translated: Among these, the defeat is the most serious downfall.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma ni 'bring ngo ;🔽/ de las gzhan pa ni ltung ba chung ngu yin no /
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma ni 'bring ngo ; / de las gzhan pa ni ltung ba chung ngu yin no /
translated: The remaining offenses are of medium seriousness.🔽The other downfalls are the least serious.

original: rnam grang gzhan yang pham pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma rnams ni lci ba'o //
analyzed: rnam grang gzhan yang pham pa dang / dge 'dun lhag ma rnams ni lci ba'o //
translated: Moreover, the defeats and the remaining offenses are serious.

original: ltung byed dang so sor bshags par bya ba ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: ltung byed dang so sor bshags par bya ba ni 'bring ngo //
translated: The offenses requiring confession and the downfalls are of medium seriousness.

original: nyes byas ni yang ba yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: nyes byas ni yang ba yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The wrong actions are the least serious.

original: de ltar ngo bo nyid las chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar ngo bo nyid las chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the downfalls are to be understood as being of three types according to their nature.

original: de las mi shes pas byas pa gang yin pa dang / bag med pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba chud pa yin no //
analyzed: de las mi shes pas byas pa gang yin pa dang / bag med pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba chud pa yin no //
translated: The downfall that is committed unknowingly and the downfall that is committed out of heedlessness are minor downfalls.

original: nyon mongs pa mang bas byas pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba 'bring yin no //
analyzed: nyon mongs pa mang bas byas pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba 'bring yin no //
translated: The downfall that is committed out of a multitude of afflictions is a medium downfall.

original: ma gus pas byas pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba chen por rig par bya ste /
analyzed: ma gus pas byas pa gang yin pa de ni ltung ba chen por rig par bya ste /
translated: Whatever is done out of disrespect should be known as a grave downfall.

original: de ltar na byed pa las chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na byed pa las chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the small, medium, and great should be understood in terms of the action.

original: de las 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa chung ngus byas pa gang yin pa de ni chung ngur rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las 'dod chags dang / zhe sdang dang / gti mug gis kun nas dkris pa chung ngus byas pa gang yin pa de ni chung ngur rig par bya'o //
translated: Whatever is done out of the entanglements of desire, hatred, and ignorance, should be known as small.

original: 'bring gis byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'bring ngo //
analyzed: 'bring gis byas pa gang yin pa de ni 'bring ngo //
translated: Whatever is done out of the medium entanglements should be known as medium.

original: chen pos byas pa gang yin pa de ni chen po @8b yin te ;
analyzed: chen pos byas pa gang yin pa de ni chen po @8b yin te ;
translated: Whatever is done out of the great entanglements should be known as great.

original: de ltar na bsam pa las chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na bsam pa las chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the small, medium, and great should be understood in terms of the intention.

original: bsam pa mtshungs pas gzhi rang bzhin gcig pa la byas kyang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid du 'gyur ba yang yod pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: bsam pa mtshungs pas gzhi rang bzhin gcig pa la byas kyang chung ngu dang / 'bring dang / chen po nyid du 'gyur ba yang yod pa nyid du rig par bya'o //
translated: Even when the basis is the same, the small, medium, and great should be understood in terms of the intention.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa mtshungs pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags bsams bzhin du bsad na ni ltung byed yin la /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa mtshungs pas dud 'gro'i skye gnas su skyes pa'i srog chags bsams bzhin du bsad na ni ltung byed yin la /
translated: If one kills an animal of the animal birth-state with the same motivation of anger, it is a downfall.

original: mi'am mir chags pa pha yang ma yin ma yang ma yin pa bsad na ni pham pa yin la /
analyzed: mi'am mir chags pa pha yang ma yin ma yang ma yin pa bsad na ni pham pa yin la /
translated: If one kills a human being who is neither one’s father nor mother, it is a root downfall.

original: mtshams med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: mtshams med par ni mi 'gyur ro //
translated: But it is not a heinous act.

original: zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa mtshungs pa pha'am ma bsad na ni pham pa yang yin la mtshams med par 'gyur bar yang rig par bya ste /
analyzed: zhe sdang gis kun nas dkris pa mtshungs pa pha'am ma bsad na ni pham pa yang yin la mtshams med par 'gyur bar yang rig par bya ste /
translated: If one kills one’s father or mother with the same motivation of anger, it is a root downfall and also a heinous act.

original: de ltar na gzhi'i rnam pa las ltung ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar na gzhi'i rnam pa las ltung ba chung ngu dang 'bring dang chen po nyid yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Thus, the lesser, middling, and greater downfalls should be understood in terms of the basis.

original: de la sogs pa las ni 'di ltar 'di na la la ltung ba gcig dang gnyis dang gsum nas lnga'i bar du byung yang chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa de ni tshogs pa las ltung ba chung ba yin no //
analyzed: de la sogs pa las ni 'di ltar 'di na la la ltung ba gcig dang gnyis dang gsum nas lnga'i bar du byung yang chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa de ni tshogs pa las ltung ba chung ba yin no //
translated: In this regard, if someone commits one, two, three, or up to five downfalls, but does not confess them in accordance with the teachings, that is a lesser downfall from the collection.

original: de yan chad ltung ba bcu'am /
analyzed: de yan chad ltung ba bcu'am /
translated: If one commits ten or more downfalls,

original: nyi shu'am / sum cu'am /
analyzed: nyi shu'am / sum cu'am /
translated: twenty, thirty,

original: shes par bya bar nus pa'i bar du byang ba la chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa de ni tshogs pa las ltung ba 'bring yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: shes par bya bar nus pa'i bar du byang ba la chos bzhin du phyir mi byed pa de ni tshogs pa las ltung ba 'bring yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: up to the point where one is able to know them, and one does not confess them in accordance with the Dharma, this is to be known as a serious downfall in the midst of the community.

original: ltung ba dpag tu med pa byung ba bdag la ltung ba 'di snyed cig byung ngo zhes shes par bya bar mi nus pa gang yin pa de ni tshogs pa las ltung ba chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ltung ba dpag tu med pa byung ba bdag la ltung ba 'di snyed cig byung ngo zhes shes par bya bar mi nus pa gang yin pa de ni tshogs pa las ltung ba chen po yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one does not know the number of downfalls, thinking, “I have committed so many downfalls,” this is to be known as a grave downfall in the midst of the community.

original: bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is an action?

original: gang mi byed pa'i phyir mi sbyor ba las ltung ba 'byung ba ste /
analyzed: gang mi byed pa'i phyir mi sbyor ba las ltung ba 'byung ba ste /
translated: A downfall occurs due to not applying oneself to not doing something.

original: mdor bsdu na bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
analyzed: mdor bsdu na bya ba ni rnam pa lnga ste /
translated: In brief, there are five kinds of actions:

original: tshogs kyi bya ba dang ; rnam par dag pa'i bya ba dang / grong gi bya ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi bya ba dang / 'phral gyi bya ba'o //
analyzed: tshogs kyi bya ba dang ; rnam par dag pa'i bya ba dang / grong gi bya ba dang / dge ba'i phyogs kyi bya ba dang / 'phral gyi bya ba'o //
translated: the action of the community, the action of purification, the action of the village, the action of virtue, and the action of the moment.

original: de la tshogs kyi bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshogs kyi bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The action of the community is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sar tshogs rnam pa bcu gsum bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar tshogs rnam pa bcu gsum bstan pa yin no //
translated: The thirteen types of community are taught in the Śrāvaka Grounds.

original: rnam par dag pa'i bya ba yang 'di lta ste /
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i bya ba yang 'di lta ste /
translated: The action of purification is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyis nyid du yid la byed pa bsgom pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyis nyid du yid la byed pa bsgom pa'i skabs su bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be understood as taught in the context of the cultivation of attention in the Śrāvaka Stages.

original: grong gi bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi chos gos la sogs pa'i phyir grong du 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: grong gi bya ba ni bdag nyid kyi chos gos la sogs pa'i phyir grong du 'jug pa dang / sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa'i phyir ram /
translated: The action of the village is entering the village for the sake of one’s own robes and so on, or for the sake of the Buddha, the Dharma, the Community, or fellow practitioners of celibacy,

original: ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba dang / dad pa rnams @9a * //
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams dad par bya ba dang / dad pa rnams @9a * //
translated: in order to make the faithless faithful,

original: phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir grong du 'jug pa'o //🔽dge ba'i phyogs kyi bya ba ni tshogs kyi bya ba'am /
analyzed: phyir zhing 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir grong du 'jug pa'o // dge ba'i phyogs kyi bya ba ni tshogs kyi bya ba'am /
translated: and to increase the faith of the faithful.🔽The action of the side of virtue is the action of the assembly,

original: rnam par dag pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de nyid las brtsams nas dge ba'i phyogs rnams la chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la yang dag par 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa'i bya ba gang yin pa de nyid las brtsams nas dge ba'i phyogs rnams la chos kyi rjes su mthun pa'i chos sgrub pa la yang dag par 'jug pa'o //
translated: or beginning with that very action of purification, one engages in the practice of the Dharma in accordance with the Dharma with regard to the side of virtue.

original: 'phral gyi bya ba ni lhung bzad dang chos gos kyi las dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dang / nad pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dag yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: 'phral gyi bya ba ni lhung bzad dang chos gos kyi las dang / mkhan po dang / slob dpon dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dang / nad pa la sogs pa'i bya ba dag yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The immediate duties are the duties of the begging bowl and robes, the duties to the preceptor, the duties to the teacher, the duties to the fellow brahmacārin, and the duties to the sick, and so on.

original: de dag las bzlog par bya ba lnga po de nyid kyis mi mthun pa rnam pa lngas ni bya ba ma yin pa lnga po dag ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag las bzlog par bya ba lnga po de nyid kyis mi mthun pa rnam pa lngas ni bya ba ma yin pa lnga po dag ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five kinds of improper actions are to be understood as the five kinds of improper actions that are the opposites of the five kinds of proper actions.

original: ltung ba med pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba med pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a downfall?

original: rgyu lnga kho nas ltung ba mi 'byung ste /
analyzed: rgyu lnga kho nas ltung ba mi 'byung ste /
translated: A downfall does not occur for five reasons.

original: lnga gang zhe na dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te gnas pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa de ni rgyu gcig yin no ;
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdams te gnas pa dang / zas kyi tshod rig pa dang / nam gyi cha stod dang cha smad la mi nyal bar sbyor ba'i rjes su brtson pa dang / shes bzhin du spyod pa de ni rgyu gcig yin no ;
translated: What are the five? The first reason is that one is watchful in the five matters: one is watchful with regard to the doors of the senses, with regard to the quantity of food, with regard to the night and day, with regard to posture, and with regard to the purification of the sense of spiritual taste.

original: / gzhan yang dge sbyong gi tshul la shas cher lta ba dang / ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la dad pa dang gus pa chen po dang / kha na ma tho ba kun tu spyod pa shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang /
analyzed: / gzhan yang dge sbyong gi tshul la shas cher lta ba dang / ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa rnams la dad pa dang gus pa chen po dang / kha na ma tho ba kun tu spyod pa shas cher ngo tsha shes pa dang /
translated: Furthermore, the ascetic is one who is greatly devoted to the spiritual life, who has great faith and respect for the teacher and his fellow practitioners of the spiritual life, and who has a great sense of shame and abashment with regard to the performance of any misdeed.

original: khrel yod pa dang ldan pa de ni gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: khrel yod pa dang ldan pa de ni gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second cause.

original: gzhan yang bya ba nyung ba dang / don nyung ba dang / las kyi mtha' nyung ba dang / 'du 'dzi nyung ba de ni rgyu gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang bya ba nyung ba dang / don nyung ba dang / las kyi mtha' nyung ba dang / 'du 'dzi nyung ba de ni rgyu gsum pa yin no //
translated: Furthermore, the ascetic is one who has few activities, few concerns, few duties, and few distractions. This is the third cause.

original: gzhan yang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang / bag yod pas ltung ba dang / ltung ba med pa la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gcig tu nges par byed pa de ni rgyu bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: gzhan yang khyim pa dang rab tu byung ba rnams dang mi 'dre bar gnas pa dang / bag yod pas ltung ba dang / ltung ba med pa la mkhas pa dang / dge ba'i phyogs la gcig tu nges par byed pa de ni rgyu bzhi pa yin no //
translated: Furthermore, the ascetic is one who does not associate with householders and renunciates, who is heedful, who is skilled in the rules regarding what is an offense and what is not an offense, and who is intent on virtuous qualities. This is the fourth cause.

original: gzhan yang las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa de ni rgyu lnga pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: gzhan yang las dang po pa dang / smyos pa dang / sems 'khrugs pa dang / tshor bas nyen pa de ni rgyu lnga pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: Moreover, it should be understood that there is a fifth cause for beginners, the insane, those with disturbed minds, and those afflicted by pain.

original: rgyu lnga po de dag gi dang po nyid la ltung ba mi 'byung ngo //
analyzed: rgyu lnga po de dag gi dang po nyid la ltung ba mi 'byung ngo //
translated: A downfall does not occur for those who are in the first of these five causes.

original: ltung ba las bslang ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba las bslang ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the lifting of a downfall?

original: rgyu gsum gyis ldang ste /
analyzed: rgyu gsum gyis ldang ste /
translated: It is lifted by three causes:

original: gsum gang zhe na ;
analyzed: gsum gang zhe na ;
translated: What are the three?

original: 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa dang / yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa dang / rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba'o //
analyzed: 'gyod pa lnga bskyed pa dang / yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa dang / rnam pa lngas 'gyod pa bsal ba'o //
translated: It is the production of five kinds of regret, the heedfulness that is included in the five limbs, and the removal of regret by five aspects.

original: 'di ltar 'di na la la ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byung na rgyu lngas 'gyod pa skyed par byed de /
analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la ltung ba gang yang rung ba zhig byung na rgyu lngas 'gyod pa skyed par byed de /
translated: Thus, when someone has a downfall, they should produce regret by means of five causes.

original: bdag nyid la gzhi 'dis tshul khrims dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas @9b 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / gzhan dang lha dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang /
analyzed: bdag nyid la gzhi 'dis tshul khrims dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas @9b 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / gzhan dang lha dag gis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / ston pa dang / tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyis smad par 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang /
translated: One generates regret thinking, I will be reproached by the teacher and by the wise fellow brahmacarins.🔽One generates regret thinking, By this basis, my evil reputation, fame, words, and verses will increase in all directions.

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sdig pa can gyi mi bsngags pa'i grags pa dang / sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / gzhi 'dis bdag lus zhig nas ngan song rnams su skyes par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su sdig pa can gyi mi bsngags pa'i grags pa dang / sgra dang tshigs su bcad pa mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ro snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa dang / gzhi 'dis bdag lus zhig nas ngan song rnams su skyes par gyur na mi rung ngo snyam nas 'gyod pa skyed par byed pa'o //
translated: One generates regret thinking, It is not suitable for me to be born in the lower realms after the disintegration of my body.

original: yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: yan lag lngas bsdus pa'i bag yod pa ni 'di lta ste /
translated: Carefulness that is included in five branches is as follows.

original: nyan thos kyi sar sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa dang / dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa dang / dus lnga nas bya ba dang / lhan cig rjes su spyod pa zhes bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar sngon gyi mtha' dang ldan pa dang / phyi ma'i mtha' dang ldan pa dang / dbus kyi mtha' dang ldan pa dang / dus lnga nas bya ba dang / lhan cig rjes su spyod pa zhes bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: You should understand this in the same way that it is taught in the Sravaka Levels, where it states that you should be endowed with the beginning, the end, and the middle, that you should engage in the five times, and that you should engage in these together.

original: rnam pa lnga po dag gis 'gyod pa sel bar byed ce na /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi dang bcas /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po dag gis 'gyod pa sel bar byed ce na / bcom ldan 'das kyis gzhi dang bcas /
translated: How do the five aspects clear away regret?🔽The Bhagavan taught that you should clear away regret by thinking, “There is an opportunity to rise above this downfall through the Dharma that I have taught, which is endowed with the basis and the renunciation.”

original: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas ltung ba las ldang ba'i skabs yod do snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang / mi shes pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / ma gus pa gang gis ltung ba 'byung ba mi shes pa dang /
analyzed: nges par 'byung ba dang bcas pa'i chos bstan pas ltung ba las ldang ba'i skabs yod do snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang / mi shes pa dang / bag med pa dang / nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / ma gus pa gang gis ltung ba 'byung ba mi shes pa dang /
translated: You should clear away regret by thinking, “I have not committed any other downfall that is similar to this one.”

original: ma gus pa'i bar de ni spangs shing shes pa dang / gus pa'i bar de ni yang dag par skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang / ltung ba la yang ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa thag pa nas sems skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang /
analyzed: ma gus pa'i bar de ni spangs shing shes pa dang / gus pa'i bar de ni yang dag par skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang / ltung ba la yang ltung ba mi 'byung bar bya ba'i phyir lhag pa'i bsam pa thag pa nas sems skyes so snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang /
translated: I have generated the thought of superior intention to prevent downfalls from occurring.🔽I have confessed in the presence of learned practitioners of pure conduct.

original: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi mdun du so sor bshags zin to snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas bslab pa dang 'gal na 'gyod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la dge ba dang legs pa yin gyi /
analyzed: tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams kyi mdun du so sor bshags zin to snyam nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa dang / bdag legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung nas bslab pa dang 'gal na 'gyod par byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la dge ba dang legs pa yin gyi /
translated: It is virtuous and good for me to regret violating the precepts after going forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gyod pa'i rgyun sgrib pa'i gnas lta bu rnam grangs du mar smad pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'gyod pa'i rgyun sgrib pa'i gnas lta bu rnam grangs du mar smad pa /
translated: The Bhagavān has in many ways condemned regret as a hindrance that obscures the mind.

original: bar du gcod par byed pa gang yin pa des mang du gnas shing dang du len par byed pa sel bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la dge ba dang legs pa ma yin no snyam du @10a * //
analyzed: bar du gcod par byed pa gang yin pa des mang du gnas shing dang du len par byed pa sel bar mi byed pa gang yin pa de ni bdag la dge ba dang legs pa ma yin no snyam du @10a * //
translated: “It is not good for me, it is not right for me, that I should not eliminate the many occasions for remorse that arise in me, and that I should not eliminate the many occasions for indulgence that arise in me, and that I should not eliminate the many occasions for obstacles that arise in me.”

original: rig nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa yin te /
analyzed: rig nas 'gyod pa skyes pa sel bar byed pa yin te /
translated: Having understood this, he eliminates the remorse that has arisen.

original: de ltar ltung ba las ldang bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar ltung ba las ldang bar byed do //
translated: In this way, he rises up from his downfall.

original: 'dul ba'i rjes su spyod pa'i chos ni lnga po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i rjes su spyod pa'i chos ni lnga po 'di dag yin par rig par bya ste //
translated: These five qualities should be understood as the qualities that follow the training.

original: dge slong 'dul ba la brtson pa ni de dag la rjes su spyod par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba la brtson pa ni de dag la rjes su spyod par byed do //
translated: A monk who is diligent in the training practices in relation to them.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: gnas pa dang ; gnas dang / rten dang / longs spyod dang / las ni lnga pa yin no //
analyzed: gnas pa dang ; gnas dang / rten dang / longs spyod dang / las ni lnga pa yin no //
translated: They are the basis, the place, the support, the enjoyment, and the activity.

original: de la gnas pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la gnas pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis?

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa ni 'du shes kyi gnas pa lngas gnas par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa ni 'du shes kyi gnas pa lngas gnas par byed do //
translated: A monk who is diligent in the training in the precepts lives by means of five perceptions.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: grong du 'jug pa na btson rar 'jug pa'i 'du shes dang / gtsug lag khang na rtag tu dge sbyong gi 'du shes dang ldan /
analyzed: grong du 'jug pa na btson rar 'jug pa'i 'du shes dang / gtsug lag khang na rtag tu dge sbyong gi 'du shes dang ldan /
translated: In the monastery, he always has the perception of a monk.

original: de la dge sbyong gi 'du shes ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: de la dge sbyong gi 'du shes ni 'di yin te /
translated: The perception of a monk is as follows.🔽He thinks: I have abandoned the householder’s attire and accepted an ugly form by taking on a bad color.

original: bdag ni khyim pa'i cha lugs spangs shing kha dog ngan pa khas blangs pas gzugs mi sdug pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par mdo las gnas nyi shu rtsa gnyis ji skad gsungs pa dag la so sor rtog pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag ni khyim pa'i cha lugs spangs shing kha dog ngan pa khas blangs pas gzugs mi sdug pa yin no zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par mdo las gnas nyi shu rtsa gnyis ji skad gsungs pa dag la so sor rtog pa yin no //
translated: He reflects on the twenty two topics as they are explained in the sutras.

original: zas la rtag par nad kyi gnyen po'i 'du shes dang / rab tu dben pa na mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs dang / rna bas rnam par shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams las brtsams te /
analyzed: zas la rtag par nad kyi gnyen po'i 'du shes dang / rab tu dben pa na mig gis rnam par shes par bya ba'i gzugs dang / rna bas rnam par shes par bya ba'i sgra rnams las brtsams te /
translated: He always has the perception of food as medicine, and in solitude, he begins with forms cognizable by the eye and sounds cognizable by the ear.

original: long ba dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs par 'du shes pa dang / nyal ba na dgon pa'i ri dags ltar thum phras su nyal ba'i 'du shes kyis te /
analyzed: long ba dang / 'on pa dang / lkugs par 'du shes pa dang / nyal ba na dgon pa'i ri dags ltar thum phras su nyal ba'i 'du shes kyis te /
translated: He has the perception of being blind, deaf and mute and when sleeping, he sleeps like a wild animal in the forest.

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa ni 'du shes kyi gnas lnga po de dag gis gnas par byed do //
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa ni 'du shes kyi gnas lnga po de dag gis gnas par byed do //
translated: The monk who is intent on the training in the higher morality dwells in these five stations of perception.

original: 'du shes kyi gnas pa de dag gis gnas pa ni rgyal po la 'os pa'i gos dang zas dang mal stan gyi longs spyod la gnas par gnang yang 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi rjes su sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'du shes kyi gnas pa de dag gis gnas pa ni rgyal po la 'os pa'i gos dang zas dang mal stan gyi longs spyod la gnas par gnang yang 'dod pa'i bsod snyoms kyi rjes su sbyor bar mi 'gyur ro //
translated: Dwelling in these stations of perception, he is permitted to dwell in the enjoyments of clothing, food, and bedding that are suitable for a king, but he is not engaged in the pursuit of sensual pleasures.

original: gnas gang zhe na /
analyzed: gnas gang zhe na /
translated: What is a station?

original: gnas lnga ste /
analyzed: gnas lnga ste /
translated: There are five stations:

original: dge slong gi gnas dang / dge slong ma'i gnas dang / mu stegs can gyi gnas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas so //
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas dang / dge slong ma'i gnas dang / mu stegs can gyi gnas pa dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas dang / kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas so //
translated: the station of the monk, the station of the nun, the station of the heretic, the defiled station, and the undefiled station.

original: de la dge slong gi gnas ni gang na dge slong gsar bu dang / bar ma dang gnas brtan dag gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de la dge slong gi gnas ni gang na dge slong gsar bu dang / bar ma dang gnas brtan dag gnas pa'o //
translated: The station of the monk is where young, middle-aged, and elder monks dwell.

original: dge slong ma'i gnas kyang gang na dge slong ma snga ma lta bu dang / rnam pa gsum po dag gnas pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gnas kyang gang na dge slong ma snga ma lta bu dang / rnam pa gsum po dag gnas pa'o //
translated: The station of the nun is where nuns of the three types dwell.

original: mu stegs can gyi gnas ni gang na mu stegs can gcer bu dang / @10b 'tshob pa dang / phyugs bdag pa dang / de dag la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gnas pa'o //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gnas ni gang na mu stegs can gcer bu dang / @10b 'tshob pa dang / phyugs bdag pa dang / de dag la sogs pa rnam pa sna tshogs dag gnas pa'o //
translated: The tirthika-s are the Nirgrantha-s, the Acelaka-s, the Paitri-ka-s, the Golaka-s, and so on.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas ni gang na las thams cad med pa'am /
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can gyi gnas ni gang na las thams cad med pa'am /
translated: The defiled abode is where all the actions are absent,

original: de dag las kha cig med pa'o //
analyzed: de dag las kha cig med pa'o //
translated: or where some of them are absent.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas ni gang na las thams cad yod pa'o ;
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa'i gnas ni gang na las thams cad yod pa'o ;
translated: The undefiled abode is where all the actions are present.

original: / de la dge slong gi gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni 'khor snying po can gnas la /
analyzed: / de la dge slong gi gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin pa ni 'khor snying po can gnas la /
translated: The undefiled abode of the bhiksu is where the assembly is of the essence.

original: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ni 'khor snyigs ma can gnas par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun nas nyon mongs pa can ni 'khor snyigs ma can gnas par rig par bya'o //
translated: The defiled abode is where the assembly is of the dregs.

original: de la dge slong dge slong nyid 'dod pas ni dge slong gi gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa can brtags te /
analyzed: de la dge slong dge slong nyid 'dod pas ni dge slong gi gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa can brtags te /
translated: The bhiksu who desires to be a bhiksu should examine the defiled abode of the bhiksu,

original: bkur sti rab tu spangs nas gnas par mi byed do //
analyzed: bkur sti rab tu spangs nas gnas par mi byed do //
translated: and, having completely rejected the honor, should not dwell there.

original: gnod par byung na re zhig pa'i tshul dang 'gron lam du zhugs pa na re zhig pa'i tshul dang / dge slong de dag nyid mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
analyzed: gnod par byung na re zhig pa'i tshul dang 'gron lam du zhugs pa na re zhig pa'i tshul dang / dge slong de dag nyid mi dge ba'i gnas nas bslangs te /
translated: When there is a problem, he should act like a guest; when he is on a journey, he should act like a guest.

original: dge ba'i gnas su dgod par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa ni ma gtogs so //
analyzed: dge ba'i gnas su dgod par bya ba'i phyir gnas pa ni ma gtogs so //
translated: Except for the case of a monk who is to be expelled from the community, and who is to be established in the wholesome.

original: dge slong ma'i gnas su ni gnas par mi bya ba kho na yin te /🔽sngar smos pa'i rkyen rnams ma gtogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: dge slong ma'i gnas su ni gnas par mi bya ba kho na yin te / sngar smos pa'i rkyen rnams ma gtogs pa ni snga ma bzhin no //
translated: He should not stay in the dwelling of a nun, except in the case of danger, and except in the case of the previously mentioned conditions.🔽He should not stay in the dwelling of a layman, except in the case of danger, and except in the case of the previously mentioned conditions.

original: mu stegs can gyi gnas su yang de bzhin no //
analyzed: mu stegs can gyi gnas su yang de bzhin no //
translated: He should not stay in the dwelling of a heretic, except in the case of danger, and except in the case of the previously mentioned conditions.

original: dge slong gi gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du brtags te tha na 'tsho ba tsam gyi phyir yang gnas par bya'o /
analyzed: dge slong gi gnas kun nas nyon mongs pa can ma yin par ni ji srid 'tsho'i bar du brtags te tha na 'tsho ba tsam gyi phyir yang gnas par bya'o /
translated: He should stay in a monk’s dwelling as long as he lives, except in the case of danger, and except in the case of the previously mentioned conditions. He should even stay in a defiled dwelling for the sake of mere subsistence.

original: de ltar dogs par 'gyur ba dang / rtog par 'gyur ba med pa'i gnas pa dag tu ni dge slong de gnas na tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams dogs pa dang rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar dogs par 'gyur ba dang / rtog par 'gyur ba med pa'i gnas pa dag tu ni dge slong de gnas na tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa rnams dogs pa dang rtog par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The monk who lives in such a way that he is not suspected or thought to be of bad character is not suspected or thought to be of bad character by his wise companions in the celibate life.

original: rten gang zhe na /
analyzed: rten gang zhe na /
translated: What is the basis?

original: rten kyang lnga ste /
analyzed: rten kyang lnga ste /
translated: The basis is fivefold:

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: grong sogs la brten pa dang / gnas la brten pa dang / gang zag la brten pa dang / chos gos la sogs pa yo byad la brten pa dang / spyod lam la brten pa'o //
analyzed: grong sogs la brten pa dang / gnas la brten pa dang / gang zag la brten pa dang / chos gos la sogs pa yo byad la brten pa dang / spyod lam la brten pa'o //
translated: The basis of a village, etc., the basis of a dwelling, the basis of a person, the basis of robes, etc., and the basis of deportment.

original: de la grong ngam grong khyer la brten te yul gyi phyogs gang na gnas pa de ni de'i grong tshigs la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: de la grong ngam grong khyer la brten te yul gyi phyogs gang na gnas pa de ni de'i grong tshigs la brten pa yin no //
translated: The basis of a village, etc., is the region in which one lives, whether it be a village, town, city, or country.

original: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba'am gtsug lag khang ngam khang khyim mam /🔽'chags las nye bar brten cing gnas pa de ni de'i gnas la brten pa yin no //🔽sbyin bdag gam /
analyzed: dge 'dun gyi kun dga' ra ba'am gtsug lag khang ngam khang khyim mam / 'chags las nye bar brten cing gnas pa de ni de'i gnas la brten pa yin no // sbyin bdag gam /
translated: The basis of a dwelling is a monastery, a temple, a house, or a cave belonging to the community.

original: slob dpon nam mkha' po'am /
analyzed: slob dpon nam mkha' po'am /
translated: The basis of a person is a preceptor, an instructor, or a fellow student.🔽The basis of robes, etc., is the robes, alms-food, bedding, seats, remedies for sickness, and other personal belongings of the monk.🔽The basis of deportment is the proper conduct of the monk in regard to walking, standing, sitting, lying down, and other activities.

original: gleng ba po'am /
analyzed: gleng ba po'am /
translated: the speaker,

original: dran par byed pa'am /🔽'doms par byed pa'am /
analyzed: dran par byed pa'am / 'doms par byed pa'am /
translated: the one who reminds,🔽the one who instructs,

original: rjes su ston par byed pa'am /
analyzed: rjes su ston par byed pa'am /
translated: the one who teaches,

original: chos ston pa la nye bar @11a * //
analyzed: chos ston pa la nye bar @11a * //
translated: the one who is dependent on and relies on the teaching of the Dharma.

original: brten cing gnas pa de ni de'i gang zag la brten pa yin no //🔽chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad ngan pa'am /
analyzed: brten cing gnas pa de ni de'i gang zag la brten pa yin no // chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad ngan pa'am /
translated: The person who is dependent on and relies on the Dharma is the one who is dependent on the person.🔽The person who is dependent on and relies on the requisites of the Dharma robe, etc.

original: bzang po ji lta bu la brten cing gnas pa de ni de'i chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad la brten pa yin no //
analyzed: bzang po ji lta bu la brten cing gnas pa de ni de'i chos gos la sogs pa'i yo byad la brten pa yin no //
translated: is the one who is dependent on and relies on the requisites of the Dharma robe, etc.

original: de de na dus dus su spyod lam rnam pa bzhis ci bde bar go rims bzhin du gnas pa de ni de'i spyod lam la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: de de na dus dus su spyod lam rnam pa bzhis ci bde bar go rims bzhin du gnas pa de ni de'i spyod lam la brten pa yin te /
translated: The person who is dependent on and relies on the postures is the one who, from time to time, remains in any of the four postures in whatever way is comfortable.

original: rten de dag la brten cing gnas na bdag la bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba don med pa dang ldan pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: rten de dag la brten cing gnas na bdag la bdag nyid sdug bsngal ba don med pa dang ldan pas gnod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If one relies on and remains in these supports, one will not be harmed by the useless suffering of oneself.

original: longs spyod gang zhe na /
analyzed: longs spyod gang zhe na /
translated: What is enjoyment?

original: longs spyod mi rung ba lnga dang / rung ba lngar rig par bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod mi rung ba lnga dang / rung ba lngar rig par bya ste /
translated: It should be understood as the five kinds of enjoyment that are not proper and the five kinds of enjoyment that are proper.

original: longs spyod mi rung ba lnga ni mchod rten gyi ni nad tshabs che ba ma yin pa dang / rton pa gzhan yod pa la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: longs spyod mi rung ba lnga ni mchod rten gyi ni nad tshabs che ba ma yin pa dang / rton pa gzhan yod pa la mi rung ngo //
translated: the enjoyment of a stupa, except for the enjoyment of the site of a stupa by one who is not seriously ill and who has other resources;

original: dge 'dun ni ma bsgo ba dang / lhung bzed du ma chud pa dang / ma gtogs pa la mi rung ngo //
analyzed: dge 'dun ni ma bsgo ba dang / lhung bzed du ma chud pa dang / ma gtogs pa la mi rung ngo //
translated: the enjoyment of the Saṅgha, except for the enjoyment of the Saṅgha’s property by one who has not been ordered by the Saṅgha to enjoy it, or who has not been placed in a begging bowl by the Saṅgha;

original: gang zag gzhan gyi ni ma byin pa dang / rjes su ma gnang pa dang / yid mi gcugs pa la mi rung ngo //🔽rang gi gang zag ni bshad pa la sogs pa las byas pa'am /
analyzed: gang zag gzhan gyi ni ma byin pa dang / rjes su ma gnang pa dang / yid mi gcugs pa la mi rung ngo // rang gi gang zag ni bshad pa la sogs pa las byas pa'am /
translated: the enjoyment of another person’s property, except for the enjoyment of the property of a person who has given it, or who has given his consent, or who has confidence in you;

original: de dang 'dres pa thams cad kyi thams cad du longs spyod du mi rung ngo //
analyzed: de dang 'dres pa thams cad kyi thams cad du longs spyod du mi rung ngo //
translated: the enjoyment of your own property, except for the enjoyment of all of your property that has been dedicated to the Dharma, or that has been dedicated to a stupa, or that has been dedicated to the Saṅgha;🔽the enjoyment of all of your property that has been dedicated to the Dharma, or that has been dedicated to a stupa, or that has been dedicated to the Saṅgha, except for the enjoyment of the property that has been dedicated to the Dharma, or that has been dedicated to a stupa, or that has been dedicated to the Saṅgha by you.🔽“If you rely on a person, your virtuous qualities will decline and your non-virtuous qualities will increase.

original: bsten na de'i dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / bsten na 'jig rten 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyis smad pa'am /
analyzed: bsten na de'i dge ba'i chos rnams yongs su nyams par 'gyur zhing mi dge ba'i chos rnams mngon par 'phel bar 'gyur ba gang yin pa dang / bsten na 'jig rten 'khrug par 'gyur ba dang / 'jig rten gyis smad pa'am /
translated: If you rely on a person, the world will be disturbed and the world will criticize you.

original: ma dad pa rnams dad par mi 'gyur zhing dad pa rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mi rung ste /
analyzed: ma dad pa rnams dad par mi 'gyur zhing dad pa rnams gzhan du 'gyur ba yang mi rung ste /
translated: It is not suitable for those who lack faith to generate faith, nor for those who have faith to change their minds.

original: lnga po de dag ni longs spyod mi rung ba yin pas dge sbyong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas de dag yongs su spang par bya'o //
analyzed: lnga po de dag ni longs spyod mi rung ba yin pas dge sbyong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas de dag yongs su spang par bya'o //
translated: These five are unsuitable to enjoy, so the monk who is diligent in the training of the Vinaya should abandon them.

original: longs spyod rung ba lnga ni de dag las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: longs spyod rung ba lnga ni de dag las bzlog pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The five that are suitable to enjoy should be understood as the opposite of those.

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas de dag ni yongs su spyad par bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas de dag ni yongs su spyad par bya'o //
translated: The monk who is diligent in the training of the Vinaya should enjoy those.

original: de ltar longs spyod mi rung ba yongs su spong ba'i dge slong dang / longs spyod rung ba la rjes su 'jug pa'i dge slong ni dad pas byin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
analyzed: de ltar longs spyod mi rung ba yongs su spong ba'i dge slong dang / longs spyod rung ba la rjes su 'jug pa'i dge slong ni dad pas byin pa yongs su sbyong bar byed do //
translated: Thus, the monk who abandons what is unsuitable to enjoy and who engages in what is suitable to enjoy purifies what is given in faith.

original: las gang zhe na /
analyzed: las gang zhe na /
translated: What is action?

original: las ni mdor bsdu na bzhi ste /
analyzed: las ni mdor bsdu na bzhi ste /
translated: In brief, action is fourfold:

original: gsol ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang / lan gsum brjod pa'i las so //
analyzed: gsol ba'i las dang / gsol ba dang gnyis kyi las dang / gsol ba dang bzhi'i las dang / lan gsum brjod pa'i las so //
translated: the action of proposal, the action of proposal and two, the action of proposal and four, and the action of recitation three times.

original: las bzhi'i de dag kyang gzhi gnyis la brten pa yin te /
analyzed: las bzhi'i de dag kyang gzhi gnyis la brten pa yin te /
translated: These four actions are also based on two bases:

original: sems can du bgrang ba @11b dang ; sems can du bgrang ba ma yin no //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba @11b dang ; sems can du bgrang ba ma yin no //
translated: sentient beings and non-sentient beings.

original: de la sems can du bgrang ba'i gzhi las ni rab tu dbyung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gang zag yid mthun par bya ba dang / ltung ba las bslang ba dang / dgar ba dang / bskrad pa dang / dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dang /
analyzed: de la sems can du bgrang ba'i gzhi las ni rab tu dbyung ba dang / bsnyen par rdzogs pa dang / gang zag yid mthun par bya ba dang / ltung ba las bslang ba dang / dgar ba dang / bskrad pa dang / dbyar gnas par khas blangs pa dang /
translated: Among them, actions based on sentient beings are: going forth, full ordination, acting in harmony with the person, lifting downfalls, reconciliation, banishment, accepting the rainy season retreat,🔽blessing for seven days, twenty days, and forty days, benefiting sentient beings, and any actions of punishment.

original: zhag bdun dang / nyi shu dang / bzhi bcur byin gyis brlab pa dang / sems can la phan gdags pa dang / chad pas bcad pa'i las gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrang ba'i gzhi'i las zhes bya'o //
analyzed: zhag bdun dang / nyi shu dang / bzhi bcur byin gyis brlab pa dang / sems can la phan gdags pa dang / chad pas bcad pa'i las gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrang ba'i gzhi'i las zhes bya'o //
translated: These are called actions based on the basis of sentient beings.

original: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i gzhi las ni chos gos dang lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sra brkyang byin gyis brlabs pa dang / chos gos rnams dang mi 'bral bar bsdam pa dang / mtshams bcad pa dang / khyim rung bar yid mthun par bya ba gang yin pa dang /
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i gzhi las ni chos gos dang lhung bzed byin gyis brlabs pa dang / sra brkyang byin gyis brlabs pa dang / chos gos rnams dang mi 'bral bar bsdam pa dang / mtshams bcad pa dang / khyim rung bar yid mthun par bya ba gang yin pa dang /
translated: The basis of what is not a sentient being is the basis of the consecration of the Dharma robes and alms bowl, the consecration of the rainy season retreat, the binding of the Dharma robes that are not to be separated from, the cutting off of the boundary, and the agreement of the householders.

original: de lta bu dang mthun pa'i gzhi las gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i gzhi las yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de lta bu dang mthun pa'i gzhi las gang yin pa de ni sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'i gzhi las yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: That which is similar to that is to be known as the basis of what is not a sentient being.

original: las de dag kyang tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba dang / tshogs bzhis bya ba dang / tshogs lngas bya ba dang / tshogs bcus bya ba dang / tshogs nyi shus bya ba dang / tshogs bzhi bcus bya ba dang / dge 'dun mthun pas bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: las de dag kyang tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba dang / tshogs bzhis bya ba dang / tshogs lngas bya ba dang / tshogs bcus bya ba dang / tshogs nyi shus bya ba dang / tshogs bzhi bcus bya ba dang / dge 'dun mthun pas bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: Those actions are to be known as being done by the two assemblies, the four assemblies, the five assemblies, the ten assemblies, the twenty assemblies, the forty assemblies, and the harmonious saṅgha.

original: de la tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la tshogs gnyis kyis bya ba 'di lta ste /
translated: Therein, the two assemblies are as follows:

original: dge slong gis dge slong gi mdun du lan gsum brjod cing bshags pa'o //
analyzed: dge slong gis dge slong gi mdun du lan gsum brjod cing bshags pa'o //
translated: A monk confesses in the presence of a monk by repeating it three times.

original: las kyi ltung byed dam nyes byas kyi nyes pa 'chags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: las kyi ltung byed dam nyes byas kyi nyes pa 'chags par byed pa'o //
translated: He confesses a downfall due to a misdeed or a minor infraction.

original: tshogs bzhis bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la nyes pa sbom po byung ba bzhi'i mdun du 'chags par byed pa'o //
analyzed: tshogs bzhis bya ba ni 'di ltar 'di na la la nyes pa sbom po byung ba bzhi'i mdun du 'chags par byed pa'o //
translated: An act done by a group of four is, for example, the confession of a serious downfall in the presence of four monks.

original: tshogs lngas bya ba ni mtha' 'khob tu bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i las so //🔽tshogs bcus bya ba yul dbus su bsnyen bar rdzogs pa'i las yin par blta bar bya'o //🔽tshogs nyi shus bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: tshogs lngas bya ba ni mtha' 'khob tu bsnyen par rdzogs par bya ba'i las so // tshogs bcus bya ba yul dbus su bsnyen bar rdzogs pa'i las yin par blta bar bya'o // tshogs nyi shus bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: An act done by a group of five is, for example, the ceremony for full ordination in a remote region.🔽An act done by a group of ten is, for example, the ceremony for full ordination in a central region.

original: dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba'i las yin par blta bar bya'o //
analyzed: dge 'dun lhag ma las dbyung ba'i las yin par blta bar bya'o //
translated: An act done by a group of twenty is, for example, the ceremony to lift a suspension for not seeing an offense.

original: tshogs bzhi bcus bya ba ni dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: tshogs bzhi bcus bya ba ni dge slong ma bsnyen par rdzogs pa'i las yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: An act done by a group of forty is, for example, the ceremony for full ordination of a nun.

original: dge 'dun mthun pas bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge 'dun mthun pas bya ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: An act done by a unanimous community is, for example, the ceremony for full ordination.

original: mtshams kyi las dang / gso sbyong gi las dang / dgag dbye'i las dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: mtshams kyi las dang / gso sbyong gi las dang / dgag dbye'i las dang / gzhan yang de lta bu dang mthun pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: the ceremony of the rainy season retreat, the ceremony of the lifting of the restrictions, and any other similar ceremonies.

original: las rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang gzhi'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du ma yod par rig par @12a * //
analyzed: las rnam pa bzhi po de dag kyang gzhi'i rab tu dbye bas rnam pa du ma yod par rig par @12a * //
translated: These four types of ceremonies are to be understood as having many subdivisions based on their bases.

original: bya'o ; /'di lta ste /
analyzed: bya'o ; /'di lta ste /
translated: For example,

original: 'dul ba'i ma mo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
analyzed: 'dul ba'i ma mo las 'byung ba bzhin no //
translated: as they are found in the Vinaya scriptures.

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa de ltar las shes pa ni las rnams la rjes su spyod pa ni /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa de ltar las shes pa ni las rnams la rjes su spyod pa ni /
translated: A monk who is diligent in the training of the Vinaya and who knows the ceremonies in this way is one who practices in accordance with the ceremonies.

original: ltung ba la yang mkhas pa yin /
analyzed: ltung ba la yang mkhas pa yin /
translated: He is also one who is skilled in the offenses,

original: ltung ba las nges par 'byung ba la yang mkhas pa yin la /
analyzed: ltung ba las nges par 'byung ba la yang mkhas pa yin la /
translated: and he is also one who is skilled in the means of deliverance from the offenses.

original: bdag nyid kyang dag pa ngang gtsang bar yongs su srung zhing kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang dag pa ngang gtsang bar yongs su srung zhing kha na ma tho ba med pa yin no //
translated: He himself is one who guards his purity and his cleanness well and is one who is without reproach.

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos ni lngar shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i bslab pa dang mi mthun pa'i chos ni lngar shes par bya ste /
translated: A monk who is diligent in the training of the Vinaya should know that there are five qualities that are adverse to the training.

original: des de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
analyzed: des de dag yongs su spang bar bya'o //
translated: He should completely avoid them.

original: bslab pa dang mthun pa yang lnga ste /
analyzed: bslab pa dang mthun pa yang lnga ste /

original: de dag gi bslab pa yang dag par sgrub par byed do //

original: bslab pa dang mi mthun pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bslab pa dang mi mthun pa lnga gang zhe na /

original: bar du gcod pa dang / dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa dang / sdig pa'i grogs po dang / glen zhing nyon mongs pa mang ba dang / sngon gyi tshogs stobs chung ba ni lnga pa yin no //

translated: They are: obstacles, false doctrines, bad friends, stupidity, and weakness of the roots of virtue.

original: bar du gcod pa lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: bar du gcod pa lnga gang zhe na /

original: lhag pa'i tshul khrims kyi bar du gcod pa dang / lhag pa'i sems kyi bar du gcod pa dang / lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bar du gcod pa dang / bde 'gror 'gro ba'i bar du gcod pa dang / rnyed pa dang srog dang 'phral gyi bya ba'i bar du gcod pa'o //

original: dam pa'i chos las 'dun pa bzlog pa dang / dam pa'i chos la skur pa 'debs pa dang / de ltar de lta bu la sogs pa ni lhag pa'i shes rab kyi bar @12b du gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o //

analyzed: 'di ltar 'di na la la sdig pa 'dod pa dang / log par lta ba dang / khro ba dang / khon du 'dzin pa dang / rgyas par de lta bu'i ngan song gi rgyu yang dag par blang ba de lta bu la 'jug pa de ni bde 'gror 'gro ba'i bar du gcod pa zhes bya'o //
translated: It is like this: Here, someone desires evil, has wrong views, is angry, bears grudges, and in detail engages in such causes of bad rebirths. This is called the obstacle to going to good rebirths.

analyzed: rnyed pa'i bar du gcod pa ni 'di lta ste /

analyzed: ma dad pa rnams dad par mi 'gyur ba dang / dad pa rnams gzhan du 'gyur zhing dad par mi 'gyur ba'i phyir zhugs pa dang / bsod nams mi 'dod pa dang / dus dang dus su sbyin pa las byung ba'i bsod nams bya ba'i dngos pos gzhan dag la phan pa nye bar sgrub par mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to not desire merit, and to not benefit others through the meritorious activities that arise from generosity at the appropriate times.

original: de ltar de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is to be like that and so on.

original: srog gi bar du gcod pa ni glang po che gtum po thag ring du spong bar mi byed pa dang / rgyas par yams kyi nad dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa'i yul yongs su spong bar mi byed pa dang / rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis tshe ma zad par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba de dag yongs su spong bar mi byed pa dang /
analyzed: srog gi bar du gcod pa ni glang po che gtum po thag ring du spong bar mi byed pa dang / rgyas par yams kyi nad dang bcas pa dang / gnod pa dang bcas pa'i yul yongs su spong bar mi byed pa dang / rgyu gang dag dang rkyen gang dag gis tshe ma zad par 'chi ba'i dus byed par 'gyur ba de dag yongs su spong bar mi byed pa dang /
translated: It is to not avoid wild elephants, and to not avoid countries that have epidemics and are dangerous. It is to not avoid the causes and conditions that lead to death before one’s time.

original: de ltar de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
analyzed: de ltar de lta bu la sogs pa yin no //
translated: It is to be like that and so on.

original: 'phral gyi bya ba'i bar du gcod pa ni chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa'i las gang dag yin pa de dag la brtson par mi byed pa ste ;
analyzed: 'phral gyi bya ba'i bar du gcod pa ni chos gos dang lhung bzed la sogs pa'i las gang dag yin pa de dag la brtson par mi byed pa ste ;
translated: The obstacles to immediate action are the activities of the Dharma robes, alms bowl, and so on, and not being diligent in those activities.

original: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnyed pa dang srog dang 'phral gyi bya ba'i bar du gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de dag gcig tu bsdus pa ni rnyed pa dang srog dang 'phral gyi bya ba'i bar du gcod pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: These are to be known as the obstacles to gain, life, and immediate action.

original: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa gang zhe na /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa gang zhe na /
translated: What is a counterfeit of the true Dharma?

original: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su dgongs par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa ni mdor bsdu na rnam pa gnyis su dgongs par rig par bya ste /
translated: In brief, it should be understood that a counterfeit of the true Dharma is intended to be twofold:

original: bshad pa dam pa'i chos ltar thos pa dang / sgrub pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa'o //🔽chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes shing /
analyzed: bshad pa dam pa'i chos ltar thos pa dang / sgrub pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa'o // chos ma yin pa la chos su 'du shes shing /
translated: the counterfeit of the true Dharma as teaching and the counterfeit of the true Dharma as practice.🔽What is the counterfeit of the true Dharma as teaching?🔽It is the counterfeit of the true Dharma as teaching when one, perceiving what is not the Dharma as the Dharma,

original: chos ma yin pa la chos su ston pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de la chos bstan to snyam du chos su 'du shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
analyzed: chos ma yin pa la chos su ston pa dang / gzhan dag kyang de la chos bstan to snyam du chos su 'du shes pa dang ldan par 'gyur la /
translated: teaches what is not the Dharma as the Dharma, and when others, perceiving what is not the Dharma as the Dharma, come to believe that one is teaching the Dharma.

original: de yang yang dag pa dang bden par chos ma yin zhing chos lta bur snang ba yin pa de'i phyir bshad pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa zhes bya'o //
analyzed: de yang yang dag pa dang bden par chos ma yin zhing chos lta bur snang ba yin pa de'i phyir bshad pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa zhes bya'o //
translated: Moreover, it is not the true Dharma, but appears to be the Dharma. Therefore, it is called a counterfeit of the true Dharma.

original: de gzhan dag la yang de ltar 'chad cing 'dzin du 'jug par byed la /
analyzed: de gzhan dag la yang de ltar 'chad cing 'dzin du 'jug par byed la /
translated: One teaches that to others and causes them to take it up.

original: bdag nyid kyang de ltar zhugs shing chos su 'du shes pas log pa kho nar zhugs bzhin du bdag ni yang dag par zhugs pa yin no snyam du bdag nyid kyis @13a * //
analyzed: bdag nyid kyang de ltar zhugs shing chos su 'du shes pas log pa kho nar zhugs bzhin du bdag ni yang dag par zhugs pa yin no snyam du bdag nyid kyis @13a * //
translated: One also engages in it oneself, and with the perception of it as the Dharma, one thinks, “I am engaged in the true Dharma.”

original: kun du shes par byed pa 'di ni bsgrub pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: kun du shes par byed pa 'di ni bsgrub pa dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: One causes others to understand that. This is to be known as a counterfeit of the practice of the true Dharma.

original: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa brgyad pa rnams kyi bar sdom ni //
analyzed: dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa brgyad pa rnams kyi bar sdom ni //
translated: The summary of the eight counterfeit aspects of the true Dharma is:

original: chos la sogs pa rnam lnga dang // dbang po la sogs rnam lnga dang // gnas ma yin pas 'gyod sogs dang // drag shul khrims 'chal tha ma yin //
analyzed: chos la sogs pa rnam lnga dang // dbang po la sogs rnam lnga dang // gnas ma yin pas 'gyod sogs dang // drag shul khrims 'chal tha ma yin //
translated: The five beginning with the Dharma, the five beginning with the faculties, the five beginning with the non-basis, regret, and so on, and the five beginning with the harsh.

original: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde la tshig 'bru bcos pa dag gis mdo sde la lhad 'jug pa'i spong ba dang / 'dul ba la lhad 'jug cing spong ba ni dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pas gsungs pa'i mdo sde la tshig 'bru bcos pa dag gis mdo sde la lhad 'jug pa'i spong ba dang / 'dul ba la lhad 'jug cing spong ba ni dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
translated: The counterfeit of the true Dharma is the rejection of the sutras and the Vinaya which are the words of the Tathagata, by those who alter the words and letters of the sutras.

original: sgro 'dogs pa'i lta bas med pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i lta bas yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don gzhan dag la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang bdag nyid de lta de ltar sgrub pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs pa'i lta bas med pa la sgro 'dogs pa dang / skur ba 'debs pa'i lta bas yod pa'i dngos po 'jig pa'i tshul gyis mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i don gzhan dag la ston pa dang / 'chad pa dang bdag nyid de lta de ltar sgrub pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
translated: The counterfeit of the true Dharma is the teaching, the exposition, and the practice of other meanings such as impermanence, etc., by means of a theory of reification which reifies what does not exist and a theory of repudiation which repudiates what does exist.

original: gang zag dang ldan pa bshad pa'i mdo sde la log par 'dzin pa'i gang zag yod pa nyid du ston pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
analyzed: gang zag dang ldan pa bshad pa'i mdo sde la log par 'dzin pa'i gang zag yod pa nyid du ston pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
translated: The counterfeit of the true Dharma is the teaching that the person exists in the sutras which teach the possession of the person.

original: rtags su yod pa'i chos rnams rdzas su yod pa nyid du yongs su ston pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
analyzed: rtags su yod pa'i chos rnams rdzas su yod pa nyid du yongs su ston pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
translated: The counterfeit of the true Dharma is the teaching that the dharmas which exist as signs exist substantially.

original: mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa la dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa dang / yod pa dang med par ston pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
analyzed: mya ngan las 'das pa spros pa med pa la dngos po dang dngos po med par rtog pa dang / yod pa dang med par ston pa yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
translated: The teaching of existence and nonexistence is also a counterfeit of the true Dharma.

original: gang zag la la 'di skad ces bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdam pa nyid ba stod cing bsngags te /
analyzed: gang zag la la 'di skad ces bcom ldan 'das kyis dbang po rnams kyi sgo bsdam pa nyid ba stod cing bsngags te /
translated: Some people say, “The Blessed One praised, extolled, and lauded the closing of the doors of the senses.

original: rab tu bstod pas na gzugs rnams la mi lta ba ni bla'i dran pa nye bar bzhag ste lta ba ni de lta ma yin la yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes zer ba de
analyzed: rab tu bstod pas na gzugs rnams la mi lta ba ni bla'i dran pa nye bar bzhag ste lta ba ni de lta ma yin la yid kyis rnam par shes par bya ba'i chos rnams kyi bar du yang de bzhin du rig par bya'o zhes zer ba de
translated: Therefore, it is better not to look at forms than to look at them with mindfulness. The same should be understood as far as the mental consciousness of mental objects.🔽”

original: yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //
analyzed: yang dam pa'i chos ltar bcos pa yin no //

analyzed: dge ba'i rtsa ba gzhan gang yin pa de dag dang zhes bya ba rgyas par mdo las longs spyod che ba dang / rtsa 'jing che ba dang / g-yog 'khor mang bzhes ji skad gsungs pa yin te /
