original: de ni sngon bsod nams byas pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags dang po yin par rig par bya'o //🔽gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa ni rab tu bag med par gyur kyang gnod sbyin dang mi ma yin pa gdug pa gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de ni sngon bsod nams byas pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags dang po yin par rig par bya'o // gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa ni rab tu bag med par gyur kyang gnod sbyin dang mi ma yin pa gdug pa gnyug mar gnas pa dag gis 'di lta ste /
translated: This should be understood as the first sign of the benefit of the result of previously created merit.

original: longs spyod kyi bar chad dam srog gi bar chad bya bar mi nus te /
analyzed: longs spyod kyi bar chad dam srog gi bar chad bya bar mi nus te /
translated: Moreover, even if one is extremely careless, the malevolent yakshas and rakshasas who dwell in the area are unable to create obstacles to one's enjoyments or to one's life.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags gnyis pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags gnyis pa yin no //
translated: This is the second sign of the benefit of the result.

original: gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa'i phyir sems 'jug par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa ni rang bzhin gyis dge ba'i chos rnams bsgom pa'i phyir sems 'jug par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, one who has previously created merit naturally engages in the cultivation of virtuous qualities.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags gsum pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags gsum pa yin no //
translated: This is the third sign of the benefit of the result.

original: gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa ni rang bzhin gyis sdig pa'i spyod pas gdung zhing 'dzem la /🔽sdig pa byas na yang dus dus su 'gyod pa'i sems drag po 'thob cing 'gyod pa byas pa des sdig pa srab mor @17a * //
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa ni rang bzhin gyis sdig pa'i spyod pas gdung zhing 'dzem la / sdig pa byas na yang dus dus su 'gyod pa'i sems drag po 'thob cing 'gyod pa byas pa des sdig pa srab mor @17a * //
translated: Moreover, one who has previously created merit is naturally restrained and scrupulous about engaging in evil conduct.🔽Even if one does evil, one repeatedly experiences a strong sense of remorse.

original: byed pa phyis kyang sdig pa spong bar byed de /
analyzed: byed pa phyis kyang sdig pa spong bar byed de /
translated: By that remorse, one weakens the evil and later abandons the evil.

original: de ni 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags bzhi pa yin no //
analyzed: de ni 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags bzhi pa yin no //
translated: This is the fourth sign of the benefit of the result.

original: gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa la ni las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba thams cad dang bsam pa'i skyes bu'i bye brag thams cad mang zhing mthun pa dang tshegs chung ngus 'grub par 'gyur te /
analyzed: gzhan yang sngon bsod nams byas pa la ni las kyi mtha'i sbyor ba thams cad dang bsam pa'i skyes bu'i bye brag thams cad mang zhing mthun pa dang tshegs chung ngus 'grub par 'gyur te /
translated: Moreover, for one who has previously created merit, all the activities of work and all the various aspects of intention are accomplished with little difficulty, with favorable conditions and in abundance.

original: de ni gang zag sngon bsod nams byas pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags lnga pa yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de ni gang zag sngon bsod nams byas pa'i 'bras bu'i phan yon gyi rtags lnga pa yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: This should be known as the fifth sign of the benefit of the result for a person who has previously created merit.

original: de dag ni lha rnams kyi nang nas lhar gyur pa rnams dang / mi rnams kyi nang nas mir gyur pa rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi shing rta'i 'khor lo bzhi ste /
analyzed: de dag ni lha rnams kyi nang nas lhar gyur pa rnams dang / mi rnams kyi nang nas mir gyur pa rnams kyi zhi gnas dang / lhag mthong gi shing rta'i 'khor lo bzhi ste /
translated: These are the four wheels of serenity and insight for those who are gods among the gods and humans among the humans.

original: gang yang rung ba zhig med na ni shing rta de 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro //🔽spong ba'i yan lag lnga ni thob bar bya ba'i don la mngon par yid ches pa dang / bla ma rnams la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin smra ba dang / lus spro ba dang / sems spro ba dang / legs par gsungs pa dang /
analyzed: gang yang rung ba zhig med na ni shing rta de 'gro bar mi 'gyur ro // spong ba'i yan lag lnga ni thob bar bya ba'i don la mngon par yid ches pa dang / bla ma rnams la bdag nyid ji lta ba bzhin smra ba dang / lus spro ba dang / sems spro ba dang / legs par gsungs pa dang /
translated: If any one of them is missing, the chariot will not move.

original: nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa nyid las brtsams te go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyes par bshad pa'i chos rnams kyi don shes par nus pa nyid las brtsams te go rims bzhin du rnam par gzhag par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five limbs of abandonment should be understood as being established in the following order: the ability to understand the meaning of the well-expounded and poorly-expounded teachings, faith in the object to be attained, speaking appropriately to the gurus, physical pliancy, and mental pliancy.

original: de dag las gang yang rung ba ma tshang na spong ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de dag las gang yang rung ba ma tshang na spong ba 'grub par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: If any one of them is missing, abandonment will not be accomplished.

original: bsnyen bkur las brtsams te dang po kho nar lhag pa'i tshul khrims las brtsams pa dang ; lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab la brtsams nas chos ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa'i ston pa la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: bsnyen bkur las brtsams te dang po kho nar lhag pa'i tshul khrims las brtsams pa dang ; lhag pa'i sems dang lhag pa'i shes rab la brtsams nas chos ston par mdzad pa gang yin pa'i ston pa la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: Having begun with service and worship, one should first serve and worship the teacher who teaches the Dharma beginning with the morality of the vow, the morality of collecting virtuous natures, and the morality of benefiting sentient beings.

original: de'i 'og tu gang bstan par bya ba'i chos de la yang bsnyen bkur bya'o //🔽de'i 'og tu chos dang rjes su mthun pas chos 'grub pa'i dus na lhag pa'i tshul khrims las brtsams te /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu gang bstan par bya ba'i chos de la yang bsnyen bkur bya'o // de'i 'og tu chos dang rjes su mthun pas chos 'grub pa'i dus na lhag pa'i tshul khrims las brtsams te /
translated: Then one should serve and worship the Dharma which is to be taught.

original: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: 'dul ba dang ldan pa'i bslab pa'i gzhi rnams la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: Then, when the time comes to practice the Dharma in accordance with the teaching, one should serve and worship the bases of training which are endowed with the Vinaya, beginning with the morality of the vow.

original: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i sems dang shes rab las brtsams te gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu lhag pa'i sems dang shes rab las brtsams te gdams ngag dang rjes su bstan pa la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: Then, beginning with the morality of collecting virtuous natures and the morality of benefiting sentient beings, one should serve and worship the instructions and follow-up teachings.

original: de'i 'og tu dus dus su chos kyi bgo bsha' dang / zang zing gi bgo bsha' la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu dus dus su chos kyi bgo bsha' dang / zang zing gi bgo bsha' la bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: Then, from time to time, one should serve and worship the sharing of the Dharma and the sharing of material things.

original: de la bgo bsha' ni 'di yin te chos dang zang zing dag la thun mong du gnas pa nyid dang thun mong du longs spyod pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: de la bgo bsha' ni 'di yin te chos dang zang zing dag la thun mong du gnas pa nyid dang thun mong du longs spyod pa nyid gang yin pa'o //
translated: The sharing is as follows: it is the commonality of the Dharma and material things, and the common enjoyment of them.

original: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan rnams dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par thar pa dag la @17b bsnyen bkur bya'o //
analyzed: de'i 'og tu bsam gtan rnams dang ting nge 'dzin dang snyoms par 'jug pa dang rnam par thar pa dag la @17b bsnyen bkur bya'o //
translated: After that, one should serve the meditative concentrations, the meditative attainments, the liberations, and the one-pointed concentration of mind.

original: de'i 'og tu ro myang ba med pa'i rjes su 'brang bas bden pa rab tu rtogs par bya ba dang / zag pa zad par bya ba dang / bag yod pa la bsnyen bkur bya ba ste /
analyzed: de'i 'og tu ro myang ba med pa'i rjes su 'brang bas bden pa rab tu rtogs par bya ba dang / zag pa zad par bya ba dang / bag yod pa la bsnyen bkur bya ba ste /
translated: After that, one should serve the realization of the truths, the destruction of the intoxicants, and heedfulness, by following the absence of relishing.

original: de ni bsnyen bkur rnam pa bdun gyi go rims yin par rig par bya ste //
analyzed: de ni bsnyen bkur rnam pa bdun gyi go rims yin par rig par bya ste //
translated: This is the order of the seven kinds of service.

original: de la bsnyen bkur ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de la bsnyen bkur ni rnam pa gsum gyis rig par bya'o //
translated: Service should be understood as threefold.

original: yon tan dang phan yon la yid ches pas bla mar bya ba dang yid ches pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis thun mong du legs par bsgrubs pas ri mor bya ba dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang ba dan dag gis mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: yon tan dang phan yon la yid ches pas bla mar bya ba dang yid ches pa dang / rjes su mthun pa'i lus dang ngag dang yid kyis thun mong du legs par bsgrubs pas ri mor bya ba dang / gdugs dang / rgyal mtshan dang ba dan dag gis mchod par bya'o //
translated: One should respect the guru with body, speech, and mind, with faith in his good qualities and benefits, and with faith in his instructions. One should honor the guru with body, speech, and mind, with faith in his good qualities and benefits, and with faith in his instructions. One should worship the guru with parasols, victory banners, and standards.

original: rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba la brtsams nas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la ltung ba byung ba nyid kyi tshe na mig bzhis mngon sum du bden pas ltung ba gleng bar byed cing mi bden bas ma yin zhes rgyas par bya ba ste /
analyzed: rtsod pa nye bar zhi ba la brtsams nas tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa la ltung ba byung ba nyid kyi tshe na mig bzhis mngon sum du bden pas ltung ba gleng bar byed cing mi bden bas ma yin zhes rgyas par bya ba ste /
translated: In the context of resolving disputes, one should directly address a fellow practitioner who has incurred a downfall with four eyes: one should address the downfall with truth, not with untruth.

original: de yang ma rtogs pa las rtogs pa dang dus mnyam pa kho nar ltung ba 'byin par mi byed cing ltung ba ma byung pa las dge slong rnams kyi gzhi des mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pas gleng bar mi byed de /
analyzed: de yang ma rtogs pa las rtogs pa dang dus mnyam pa kho nar ltung ba 'byin par mi byed cing ltung ba ma byung pa las dge slong rnams kyi gzhi des mthong ba dang thos pa dang dogs pas gleng bar mi byed de /
translated: One should not accuse a fellow practitioner of a downfall that he has not incurred, and one should not accuse a fellow practitioner of a downfall that he has incurred before he has realized the truth.

original: de ltar na de'i rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, his dispute is completely pacified.

original: dge slong ltung ba byed par dge slong rnams kyis mthong la /
analyzed: dge slong ltung ba byed par dge slong rnams kyis mthong la /
translated: If a monk sees another monk committing a downfall,

original: ltung ba byung ba gang yin ba des ni ltung ba brjed par 'gyur /
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba gang yin ba des ni ltung ba brjed par 'gyur /
translated: but the one who has the downfall forgets it,🔽and the one who saw it does not forget it, and if he is asked, “Do you remember the downfall?”

original: gang dag gis mthong ba de dag gis ni ma brjed na de la ltung ba dran nam zhes gzhi des gleng bar byed pa na mi dran no zhes zer na /
analyzed: gang dag gis mthong ba de dag gis ni ma brjed na de la ltung ba dran nam zhes gzhi des gleng bar byed pa na mi dran no zhes zer na /
translated: and he says, “I do not remember it,”🔽then because of his not remembering it, he should confess it.

original: de mi dran pa des dran gyis bshags par bya'o zhes bya bar yang mi bde la gzhan gyis glengs pa so sor ma bshags na 'gyod pa med par yang mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir des gzhan la yid ches pa des dge slong la dran pas 'dul ba zhes
analyzed: de mi dran pa des dran gyis bshags par bya'o zhes bya bar yang mi bde la gzhan gyis glengs pa so sor ma bshags na 'gyod pa med par yang mi 'gyur bas de'i phyir des gzhan la yid ches pa des dge slong la dran pas 'dul ba zhes
translated: If he is reminded by another, but does not confess it individually, he will not be without regret. Therefore, because of his trust in the other, he should request purification from the monk through the purification by means of recollection.

original: bya bas yongs su dag pa gsol bar bya zhing dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong de dag nyid de la yid ches pas yongs su dag par brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: bya bas yongs su dag pa gsol bar bya zhing dge 'dun gyis kyang dge slong de dag nyid de la yid ches pas yongs su dag par brjod par bya ste /
translated: The Saṅgha should also declare the purification of that monk through the purification by means of recollection, because of his trust in the other.

original: de lta na de'i rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing de yang 'gyod pa med par 'gyur la dge 'dun rnams kyis kyang gzhi des gleng par mi byed do //
analyzed: de lta na de'i rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur zhing de yang 'gyod pa med par 'gyur la dge 'dun rnams kyis kyang gzhi des gleng par mi byed do //
translated: In that case, his dispute would be completely pacified, he would be without regret, and the Saṅgha would not criticize him on that basis.

original: dge slong sems 'khrugs pa la sogs pa rmongs pa byung na dge slong gi tshul dang mi mthun pa mang po kun du spyad par gyur na de la ni gzhi des ltung ba med kyang kha cig gis de la ltung ba med par mi shes nas 'di ltar
analyzed: dge slong sems 'khrugs pa la sogs pa rmongs pa byung na dge slong gi tshul dang mi mthun pa mang po kun du spyad par gyur na de la ni gzhi des ltung ba med kyang kha cig gis de la ltung ba med par mi shes nas 'di ltar
translated: If a monk who is confused due to a disturbed mind and so on engages in many actions that are not in accord with the monk’s way of life, then he does not have a downfall on that basis. But if some do not know that he does not have a downfall,

original: gnas ma yin par @18a * //
analyzed: gnas ma yin par @18a * //
translated: they should not criticize him on a basis that is not a downfall.

original: gleng bar mi byed de dge slong rnams kyis de la ma 'ongs pa spangs pa'i phyir rang gi sems la rag las pa dge 'dun la ma smyos pas 'dul ba gsol bar gyis zhes slob par byed dran par byed na /
analyzed: gleng bar mi byed de dge slong rnams kyis de la ma 'ongs pa spangs pa'i phyir rang gi sems la rag las pa dge 'dun la ma smyos pas 'dul ba gsol bar gyis zhes slob par byed dran par byed na /
translated: The monks should instruct and remind him, “You should request the training in the Vinaya from the Saṅgha, because it depends on your own mind to abandon future actions.”

original: des kyang de dag la thos nas gsol bar bya'o //
analyzed: des kyang de dag la thos nas gsol bar bya'o //
translated: If he hears that, he should request it.

original: dge 'dun gyis kyang gang zag 'di ni ltung ba med pa yin no //
analyzed: dge 'dun gyis kyang gang zag 'di ni ltung ba med pa yin no //
translated: The Saṅgha should also say, “This person does not have a downfall.

original: zhes dge 'dun mthun par gnas pas de dag la rnam par dag par smos par byed de thos nas dge slong ma gtogs pa de dag gis kyang gzhi des de la yang gleng bar mi byed de de ltar na de'i rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur
analyzed: zhes dge 'dun mthun par gnas pas de dag la rnam par dag par smos par byed de thos nas dge slong ma gtogs pa de dag gis kyang gzhi des de la yang gleng bar mi byed de de ltar na de'i rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur
translated: Thus, when the Saṅgha remains in harmony, they should declare that the dispute is pure. Having heard that, except for the bhikṣus, they should not bring up that basis again. In that way, that dispute will be pacified.

original: ro // de dge 'dun gyi nang du dge slong gis dge slong la ltung ba gleng bar byed pa gang yin pa des ni ltung ba yod par 'du shes la gleng bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni ltung ba med par 'du shes shing bdag la ltung ba byung
analyzed: ro // de dge 'dun gyi nang du dge slong gis dge slong la ltung ba gleng bar byed pa gang yin pa des ni ltung ba yod par 'du shes la gleng bar bya ba gang yin pa de ni ltung ba med par 'du shes shing bdag la ltung ba byung
translated: “When a bhikṣu in the midst of the Saṅgha brings up a bhikṣu’s downfall, he perceives that there is a downfall, and he brings it up. He perceives that there is no downfall, and he conceives that he has not committed a downfall.

original: na med do zhes rlom par byed la gleng ba po yang tshe dang ldan pas 'di dang 'di ltar ma byas sam zhes smra zhing des kyang byas so zhes rab tu shes par byed la gleng ba po yang de ni ltung ba yin na glengs ba'i tshe ltung
analyzed: na med do zhes rlom par byed la gleng ba po yang tshe dang ldan pas 'di dang 'di ltar ma byas sam zhes smra zhing des kyang byas so zhes rab tu shes par byed la gleng ba po yang de ni ltung ba yin na glengs ba'i tshe ltung
translated: The one who brings it up says, ‘Venerable, did you not do this and that?’ and he understands, ‘I did do it.’ The one who brings it up says, ‘That is a downfall. When you brought it up, you committed a downfall.

original: ba med do zhes rlom par byed ces zer na de la dge 'dun gyis ci ltung ba yod dam 'on te med ces gzhi de'i ngo bo nyid brtsal bar bya zhing de bzhin du yang dag par lan gdab par yang bya ste /
analyzed: ba med do zhes rlom par byed ces zer na de la dge 'dun gyis ci ltung ba yod dam 'on te med ces gzhi de'i ngo bo nyid brtsal bar bya zhing de bzhin du yang dag par lan gdab par yang bya ste /
translated: If he says, “I do not have any downfalls,” the Saṅgha should investigate the nature of the matter by asking, “Do you have downfalls or not?” and he should answer truthfully.

original: de ltar na de'i rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rtsod pa de nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, that dispute will be settled.

original: gnas gang yang rung ba zhig na dge slong rab tu mang po dag ltung ba byung du dogs pa las brtsams nas ltung ba yod do //
analyzed: gnas gang yang rung ba zhig na dge slong rab tu mang po dag ltung ba byung du dogs pa las brtsams nas ltung ba yod do //
translated: “If in a certain place many monks begin a dispute, saying, ‘You have a downfall,’

original: ltung ba med do //
analyzed: ltung ba med do //
translated: ‘You do not have a downfall,’

original: lci ba yin no //
analyzed: lci ba yin no //
translated: ‘It is serious,’

original: yang ba yin no zhes rtsod par 'gyur na de la gnas gzhan la rgya che zhing mang ba gang dag yin pa dag dang / de dag bas ches byang ba mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa gang yin ba de dag la de dag gis bstan par bya ste /
analyzed: yang ba yin no zhes rtsod par 'gyur na de la gnas gzhan la rgya che zhing mang ba gang dag yin pa dag dang / de dag bas ches byang ba mdo sde dang / 'dul ba dang / ma mo 'dzin pa gang yin ba de dag la de dag gis bstan par bya ste /
translated: ‘It is minor,’ then those who are learned in the discourses, the monastic code, and the commentaries should explain the matter to the monks who are learned in the discourses, the monastic code, and the commentaries, and who are senior, long ordained, and well known.

original: de ltar de'i rtsod pa de mjug tu nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar de'i rtsod pa de mjug tu nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, that dispute will be settled.”

original: dge slong ltung ba byung na rang gis 'gyod pa'i kun nas dkris pas gleng bar byed sel bar byed cing gzhan dag gis gleng gi dogs pas chos bzhin du phyir byed de des na rtsod pa de nyid nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: dge slong ltung ba byung na rang gis 'gyod pa'i kun nas dkris pas gleng bar byed sel bar byed cing gzhan dag gis gleng gi dogs pas chos bzhin du phyir byed de des na rtsod pa de nyid nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: When a monk has a downfall, he confesses it himself with remorse, and he confesses it in accordance with the Dharma, fearing that others might point it out. Thus, that dispute is pacified right there.

original: dge slong rab tu mang po dag phan tshun ltung bas gleng bar byed cing de dag kyang nga rgyal gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa sha stag yin la phan tshun de dag 'chags par mi 'dod cing bye ba dang tha @18b dad du gyur pa dang /
analyzed: dge slong rab tu mang po dag phan tshun ltung bas gleng bar byed cing de dag kyang nga rgyal gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa sha stag yin la phan tshun de dag 'chags par mi 'dod cing bye ba dang tha @18b dad du gyur pa dang /
translated: “A great many monks dispute with each other about downfalls, and they are all overcome by pride. They do not want to confess to each other, and they split into factions,

original: gnyis su gyur cing gnas la /
analyzed: gnyis su gyur cing gnas la /
translated: becoming two groups.

original: gcig gi phyogs kyang 'di snyam du 'di dag bdag cag la 'chags par mi byed la /
analyzed: gcig gi phyogs kyang 'di snyam du 'di dag bdag cag la 'chags par mi byed la /
translated: One group thinks, ‘They are not confessing to us,

original: bdag cag gis kyang ci'i phyir 'di dag la bshags par bya snyam du sems shing phyogs cig shos kyang de kho na snyam du sems shing phyogs cig shos kyang de kho na snyam du sems par gyur na de la phyogs gnyis kar gtogs pa'i gang zag gtso bo'i🔽tshig gzung ba gnyis gzhan gyi phyogs gcig tu dong la /
analyzed: bdag cag gis kyang ci'i phyir 'di dag la bshags par bya snyam du sems shing phyogs cig shos kyang de kho na snyam du sems shing phyogs cig shos kyang de kho na snyam du sems par gyur na de la phyogs gnyis kar gtogs pa'i gang zag gtso bo'i tshig gzung ba gnyis gzhan gyi phyogs gcig tu dong la /
translated: If one side thinks, “Why should we confess to them?” and the other side thinks, “Why should we confess to them?” then the confession of that offense should be received from those persons by a person who is a neutral third party.🔽The two parties should each select one person to represent their side.

original: de dag gi rjes su gnas pas ltung ba de dag bshags par bya ste /
analyzed: de dag gi rjes su gnas pas ltung ba de dag bshags par bya ste /
translated: The confession should be received by those two persons who are neutral and who are in agreement with each other.

original: de ltar na de'i rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ltar na de'i rtsod pa nye bar zhi bar 'gyur ro //
translated: In this way, the dispute will be settled.

original: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi dang / de nye bar zhi pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang mdor bsdu na rtsod pa rnam pa bzhi dang / de nye bar zhi pa rnam pa bzhir 'gyur te /
translated: In brief, there are four kinds of disputes and four ways of settling them.

original: rtsod pa rnam bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: rtsod pa rnam bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of disputes?

original: gzhan gyis glengs pas rtsod pa dang / phan tshun the tshom za bas rtsod pa dang / bdag nyid glengs pas rtsod pa dang / phan tshun glengs pas rtsod pas so //
analyzed: gzhan gyis glengs pas rtsod pa dang / phan tshun the tshom za bas rtsod pa dang / bdag nyid glengs pas rtsod pa dang / phan tshun glengs pas rtsod pas so //
translated: Disputes arising from accusations by others, disputes arising from mutual doubts, disputes arising from accusations by oneself, and disputes arising from mutual accusations.

original: nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
analyzed: nye bar zhi ba rnam pa bzhi gang zhe na /
translated: What are the four kinds of pacification?🔽Pacification by confession, by the Sangha, by the donor, and by the nature of things.🔽Pacification by confession is when a monk who has committed a downfall confesses it to a competent monk.

original: bsams pa'i ltung ba dge 'dun la ston pas nye bar zhi ba dang / yongs su dag pas sbyin pas nye bar zhi ba dang / de'i ngo bo nyid dang gang mang ba tshol ba dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin 'gro bas nye bar zhi ba dang /
analyzed: bsams pa'i ltung ba dge 'dun la ston pas nye bar zhi ba dang / yongs su dag pas sbyin pas nye bar zhi ba dang / de'i ngo bo nyid dang gang mang ba tshol ba dang yang dag pa ji lta ba bzhin 'gro bas nye bar zhi ba dang /
translated: Pacification by the Sangha is when a monk who has committed a downfall confesses it to the Sangha and is then pacified by the Sangha.🔽Pacification by the donor is when a monk who has committed a downfall confesses it to a donor and is then pacified by the donor.🔽Pacification by the nature of things is when a monk who has committed a downfall is pacified by the nature of things, by the passage of time.

original: bshags pas nye bar zhi ba'o //
analyzed: bshags pas nye bar zhi ba'o //
translated: Pacification by confession is when a monk who has committed a downfall confesses it to a competent monk.🔽The five topics that a monk who is striving in the training of the Vinaya should know are:🔽the bases of knowledge,

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas yongs su shes par bya ba'i gnas ni lnga ste /🔽lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas yongs su shes par bya ba'i gnas ni lnga ste / lnga gang zhe na /
translated: the downfalls,🔽the individuals,🔽the substances that are to be received,

original: dngos po yongs su shes par bya ba dang / ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rdzas blang ba yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gnod pa yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
analyzed: dngos po yongs su shes par bya ba dang / ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba dang / rdzas blang ba yongs su shes par bya ba dang / gnod pa yongs su shes par bya ba'o //
translated: and the offenses.

original: de la dngos po yongs su shes par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: de la dngos po yongs su shes par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What are the bases of knowledge?🔽There are five bases of knowledge: the bases of the aggregates,

original: phung po'i dngos po la sogs pa lnga ste /
analyzed: phung po'i dngos po la sogs pa lnga ste /
translated: and so on.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: It is like this:

original: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: It is like the teaching in the Śrāvaka Vehicle.

original: gzhan yang mdor bsdu na dngos po gnyis te /
analyzed: gzhan yang mdor bsdu na dngos po gnyis te /
translated: Moreover, in brief, there are two topics:

original: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du mi ston pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du ston pa dang / sems can du mi ston pa'o //
translated: that which is taught as sentient beings and that which is not taught as sentient beings.

original: ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the thorough knowledge of downfalls?

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas rnam pa lngas ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pas rnam pa lngas ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ste /
translated: A monk who is diligent in the training of the Vinaya should know downfalls through five aspects:

original: gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / dngos po dang / sbyor ba dang / mtha' yas so //
analyzed: gzhi dang / kun nas slong ba dang / dngos po dang / sbyor ba dang / mtha' yas so //
translated: basis, motivation, substance, performance, and conclusion.

original: de la gzhi las ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi gzhi'am /
analyzed: de la gzhi las ltung ba yongs su shes par bya ba ni 'dod chags kyi gzhi'am /
translated: Among them, the thorough knowledge of downfalls from the basis is from the basis of desire or

original: zhe sdang gi gzhi las so //
analyzed: zhe sdang gi gzhi las so //
translated: the basis of hatred.

original: kun nas slong ba las ni ltung pa gang lus kyis kun nas slong bar byed la dag @19a * //
analyzed: kun nas slong ba las ni ltung pa gang lus kyis kun nas slong bar byed la dag @19a * //
translated: From the motivation, there are downfalls that are motivated by the body but not by speech

original: gis kyang ma yin /
analyzed: gis kyang ma yin /
translated: or mind.

original: sems kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sems kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There are also downfalls that are motivated by the mind but not by the body🔽or speech.

original: ngag gis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis kyang ma yin sems kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: ngag gis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis kyang ma yin sems kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is action that is instigated by speech but not by the body or the mind.🔽There is action that is instigated by the mind but not by the body or the speech.

original: sems kyis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis kyang ma yin /🔽ngag gis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do ;🔽/ lus dang ngag dag gis kyang kun nas slong bar byed la sems kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //🔽ngag dang sems kyis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
analyzed: sems kyis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis kyang ma yin / ngag gis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do ; / lus dang ngag dag gis kyang kun nas slong bar byed la sems kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do // ngag dang sems kyis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis kyang ma yin pa yang yod do //
translated: There is action that is instigated by the body and the speech but not by the mind.🔽There is action that is instigated by the body and the mind but not by the speech.🔽There is action that is instigated by the speech and the mind but not by the body.

original: lus dang ngag gis kun nas slong bar byed la /🔽sems kyis ma yin pa yang yod do //🔽ngag dang sems kyis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis ma yin ba yang yod do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag gis kun nas slong bar byed la / sems kyis ma yin pa yang yod do // ngag dang sems kyis kun nas slong bar byed la lus kyis ma yin ba yang yod do //
translated: There is action that is instigated by the body and the speech but not by the mind.🔽There is action that is instigated by the speech and the mind but not by the body.

original: lus dang ngag dang sems kyis kun nas slong ba yang yod do //
analyzed: lus dang ngag dang sems kyis kun nas slong ba yang yod do //
translated: There is action that is instigated by the body, the speech, and the mind.

original: sems 'ba' zhig gis gang zag gzhan dag gi mdun du bshags par bya dgos pa'i ltung ba kun nas slong ba med kyi bdag nyid kyis bsdam par bya ba kho na yin no //
analyzed: sems 'ba' zhig gis gang zag gzhan dag gi mdun du bshags par bya dgos pa'i ltung ba kun nas slong ba med kyi bdag nyid kyis bsdam par bya ba kho na yin no //
translated: One should restrain oneself from all downfalls that are to be confessed in the presence of other persons, with the sole exception of those downfalls that are caused by the mind.

original: 'o na ji lta zhe na 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'o na ji lta zhe na 'di lta ste /
translated: How is that?

original: dper na / dge slong 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag la rnam par rtog pa byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: dper na / dge slong 'dod pa'i rnam par rtog pa la sogs pa mi dge ba'i rnam par rtog pa dag la rnam par rtog pa byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: For example, it is like a monk who has thoughts of desire and so on, but who does not act on those thoughts.

original: dngos po las ni mdor bsdu na dngos po rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: dngos po las ni mdor bsdu na dngos po rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In terms of the entity, in brief, there are two kinds of entities:

original: sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'o //
analyzed: sems can du bgrang ba dang / sems can du bgrang ba ma yin pa'o //
translated: those that are counted as sentient beings and those that are not counted as sentient beings.

original: sbyor ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: sbyor ba yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: In terms of the performance, there are also two kinds:

original: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / bya ba mi byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
analyzed: bya ba ma yin pa byed pa'i sbyor ba dang / bya ba mi byed pa'i sbyor ba'o //
translated: the performance of what should not be done and the performance of what should be done.

original: mtha' ni gang las brtsams par gyur pa de la mthar thug par 'gro zhing bar nas phyir mi ldog pa ste /
analyzed: mtha' ni gang las brtsams par gyur pa de la mthar thug par 'gro zhing bar nas phyir mi ldog pa ste /
translated: In terms of the conclusion, the conclusion is the completion of the action without turning back in the middle.

original: des na de'i ltung ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: des na de'i ltung ba yongs su rdzogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Thus, the downfall is completed.

original: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba ni pham pa dang dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba las 'byung ngo //
analyzed: nyes pa sbom po'i ltung ba ni pham pa dang dge 'dun lhag ma'i sbyor ba las 'byung ngo //
translated: The grave offense is that which arises from the preparatory action for a defeating offense or a serious offense.

original: ltung byed dang nyes byas ni de dag gi sbyor ba dang rang gi sde tshan mthar thug pa las so //
analyzed: ltung byed dang nyes byas ni de dag gi sbyor ba dang rang gi sde tshan mthar thug pa las so //
translated: The offense requiring confession and the offense of wrong conduct are that which arises from the preparatory action for those two, and that which arises from the final stage of one's own class.

original: nyes byas ni ltung byed kyi sbyor ba las byung ngo //
analyzed: nyes byas ni ltung byed kyi sbyor ba las byung ngo //
translated: The offense of wrong conduct is that which arises from the preparatory action for an offense requiring confession.

original: de la ltung ba lhag ma dang bcas pa ni ltung ba'i sde tshan bzhi po dag go ;
analyzed: de la ltung ba lhag ma dang bcas pa ni ltung ba'i sde tshan bzhi po dag go ;
translated: Among those, the offense with remainder is the four classes of offenses.

original: / lhag ma med pa ni pham pa rnams so //
analyzed: / lhag ma med pa ni pham pa rnams so //
translated: The offense without remainder is the defeating offenses.

original: spyad pa ni yang dag par byas pa'o //
analyzed: spyad pa ni yang dag par byas pa'o //
translated: The offense that has been dealt with is the one that has been properly confessed.

original: ma spyad pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma spyad pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The offense that has not been dealt with is the opposite of that.

original: smras pa ni gzhan dag gi mdun du bshags pa'i tshul gyis chos bzhin phyir byas pa'o //
analyzed: smras pa ni gzhan dag gi mdun du bshags pa'i tshul gyis chos bzhin phyir byas pa'o //
translated: The offense that has been acknowledged is the one that has been properly confessed in the presence of others.

original: ma smras pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma smras pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The offense that has not been acknowledged is the opposite of that.

original: bsams pa ni bshags par @19b byas pa'i nyes byas phyir byin gyis brlabs pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: bsams pa ni bshags par @19b byas pa'i nyes byas phyir byin gyis brlabs pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The offense that has been thought about is the wrong conduct that has been confessed and then blessed.

original: ma bsams pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
analyzed: ma bsams pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no //
translated: The offense that has not been thought about is the opposite of that.

original: bcas pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor thar ba dang / 'dul bar ltung ba las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
analyzed: bcas pa ni bcom ldan 'das kyis so sor thar ba dang / 'dul bar ltung ba las rnam par gzhag pa yin no //
translated: The precepts are established in the Sūtra of the Individual and in the Vinaya as downfalls.

original: ma bcas pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no //🔽phyir bzhag pa ni gang zag gcig gam /
analyzed: ma bcas pa ni de las bzlog pa yin no // phyir bzhag pa ni gang zag gcig gam /
translated: The non-precepts are the opposite of that.

original: dus las brtsams pa mgo gcig tu ma byas par sngon khyad par med par bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
analyzed: dus las brtsams pa mgo gcig tu ma byas par sngon khyad par med par bcas pa gang yin pa'o //
translated: The precepts that are not fixed are those that are not made in a general way, but are made in regard to a particular person or time.

original: spyir bzhag pa ma yin pa de ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
analyzed: spyir bzhag pa ma yin pa de ni de las bzlog pa las rig par bya'o //
translated: The precepts that are not general are the opposite of that.

original: de la gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
analyzed: de la gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba ni rnam pa lngas rig par bya ste /
translated: The person should be known in five ways:

original: dpyad pa'i dbye ba dang / ris kyi dbye ba dang / mtho dman gyi dbye ba dang / 'thob pa'i dbye ba dang / brtag pa'i dbye bas so //🔽de la dpyad pa'i dbye ba ni /
analyzed: dpyad pa'i dbye ba dang / ris kyi dbye ba dang / mtho dman gyi dbye ba dang / 'thob pa'i dbye ba dang / brtag pa'i dbye bas so // de la dpyad pa'i dbye ba ni /
translated: by the analysis of the investigation, by the analysis of the class, by the analysis of the high and low, by the analysis of the attainment, and by the analysis of the investigation.

original: 'di lta ste /
analyzed: 'di lta ste /
translated: The analysis of the investigation is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: It should be known as taught in the Śrāvaka Stages.

original: ris kyi dbye bas yang dge slong dang dge slong ma la sogs pa ris bdun gyi dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ris kyi dbye bas yang dge slong dang dge slong ma la sogs pa ris bdun gyi dbye ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The classification by type should be understood as the seven types of person: fully ordained monk, fully ordained nun, and so on.

original: de la mtho dman gyi dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la mtho dman gyi dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The classification by high and low status is as follows:

original: gang zag la la rigs mthon po las rab tu byung ba dang / phyug po'i khyim nas rab tu byung ba dang / gzugs bzang ba yin la /
analyzed: gang zag la la rigs mthon po las rab tu byung ba dang / phyug po'i khyim nas rab tu byung ba dang / gzugs bzang ba yin la /
translated: Some persons go forth from a high caste, from a wealthy family, and have a good physique.

original: la la ni de lta ma yin pa ste /
analyzed: la la ni de lta ma yin pa ste /
translated: Others are not like that.

original: de ltar yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni mtho dman gyi dbye ba yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o //🔽'thob pa'i dbye ba ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba nas bzung ste /🔽gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bcu bdun dang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa nas bzung ste /
analyzed: de ltar yongs su shes pa gang yin pa de ni mtho dman gyi dbye ba yongs su shes pa zhes bya'o // 'thob pa'i dbye ba ni dad pas rjes su 'brang ba nas bzung ste / gnyis ka'i cha las rnam par grol ba'i mthar thug pa'i bar du bcu bdun dang rgyun du zhugs pa'i 'bras bu'i phyir zhugs pa nas bzung ste /
translated: Understanding this is called understanding the classification by high and low status.🔽The classification by attainment is from the stage of the person who is a follower by faith up to the stage of the person who is liberated by both parts.

original: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag ste /
analyzed: dgra bcom pa nyid kyi bar dag ste /
translated: The classification by entry is from the stage of the person who is an enterer to the fruit of stream-entry up to the stage of the person who is an enterer to the fruit of arhatship.

original: gang zag de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
analyzed: gang zag de dag gi rnam par dbye ba ni 'di lta ste /
translated: The classification by the person is as follows:

original: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi sar bstan pa bzhin no //
translated: as in the Sravakabhumi.

original: brtag pa'i dbye ba ni gang zag gleng ba pos 'di ltar gang zag yongs su brtags nas gleng bar bya ste /
analyzed: brtag pa'i dbye ba ni gang zag gleng ba pos 'di ltar gang zag yongs su brtags nas gleng bar bya ste /
translated: The analysis of the investigator is as follows: the investigator should investigate the person in this way:

original: ji gang zag 'di bdag la byams pa gus pa yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
analyzed: ji gang zag 'di bdag la byams pa gus pa yod dam zhes bya ba la sogs pa rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa bzhin du rig par bya'o //
translated: “Is there love and respect for me in this person?” and so on, as it is stated in detail in the sutra.

original: gang zag gang gleng bar bya ba gang yin pa las kyang gang zag gleng ba po la 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
analyzed: gang zag gang gleng bar bya ba gang yin pa las kyang gang zag gleng ba po la 'di ltar brtag par bya ste /
translated: The analysis of the person who is to be investigated is as follows: the investigator should investigate the person who is to be investigated in this way:

original: kye ma gang zag 'di byis pa rmongs pa chos ma yin pas gleng zhing bdag nyid smas pa dang / nyams par byed pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la @20a * //
analyzed: kye ma gang zag 'di byis pa rmongs pa chos ma yin pas gleng zhing bdag nyid smas pa dang / nyams par byed pa zhig gam zhes bya ba la @20a * //
translated: “Alas, this person is a fool, deluded, and speaks unrighteously, and he will destroy himself and be destroyed.”

original: sogs pa rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa kho na bzhin no //
analyzed: sogs pa rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa kho na bzhin no //
translated: and so on, as it is stated in detail in the sutra.

original: 'on te mkhas pa gsal ba chos bzhin du gleng zhing bdag nyid smras pa dang nyams par mi byed pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa dkar po'i phyogs kyang rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa kho na bzhin du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: 'on te mkhas pa gsal ba chos bzhin du gleng zhing bdag nyid smras pa dang nyams par mi byed pa zhig ces bya ba la sogs pa dkar po'i phyogs kyang rgyas par mdo las ji skad gsungs pa kho na bzhin du rig par bya ste /
translated: The virtuous side should be understood in detail just as it is taught in the sutras.

original: des gang zag gleng bar 'os yin nam ma yin /
analyzed: des gang zag gleng bar 'os yin nam ma yin /
translated: Is the person one who is worthy of being spoken about or not?

original: legs pa kho nar yongs su brtags na skabs dbye bar bya bya ba'am mi dbye bar bya ba de ni brtags pa'i dbye bas gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: legs pa kho nar yongs su brtags na skabs dbye bar bya bya ba'am mi dbye bar bya ba de ni brtags pa'i dbye bas gang zag yongs su shes par bya ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: If one examines only the good, one should open the discussion or not open the discussion. That is to be understood as the person who is to be known through the analysis of examination.

original: rdzas blang ba yongs su shes par bya ba gang zhe na /
analyzed: rdzas blang ba yongs su shes par bya ba gang zhe na /
translated: What is the person who is to be known through the analysis of taking up?

original: rdzas blang ba ni mdor bstun rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
analyzed: rdzas blang ba ni mdor bstun rnam pa gsum du rig par bya ste /
translated: Taking up is to be known in brief as threefold:

original: bdag nyid dang gzhan dag gi rnyed pa'i rdzas blang ba dang / ltung ba las bslang ba'i rdzas blang ba dang / dge 'dun bde bar bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims 'chal ba bskrad pa'i rdzas blang ba'o //
analyzed: bdag nyid dang gzhan dag gi rnyed pa'i rdzas blang ba dang / ltung ba las bslang ba'i rdzas blang ba dang / dge 'dun bde bar bya ba'i phyir tshul khrims 'chal ba bskrad pa'i rdzas blang ba'o //
translated: The property of oneself and others, the property of one who has been suspended for not recognizing an offense, and the property of one who has been expelled for not abandoning a faulty view, in order to bring happiness to the Sangha.

original: de la rnyed pa'i rdzas rung ba gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa yin no //🔽rung ba dgos pa dang bcas pa 'di lta ste /
analyzed: de la rnyed pa'i rdzas rung ba gang yin pa de ni yang dag pa yin no // rung ba dgos pa dang bcas pa 'di lta ste /
translated: Among these, that which is suitable as property is proper.

original: snod spyad dang yo byad mang po'i phyir ma yin pa de ni don dang ldan pa yin no //
analyzed: snod spyad dang yo byad mang po'i phyir ma yin pa de ni don dang ldan pa yin no //
translated: That which is suitable and necessary, such as for the sake of many vessels and implements, is meaningful.

original: longs spyod pa'i phyir mtshams las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni dus su yin no //
analyzed: longs spyod pa'i phyir mtshams las 'das pa gang yin pa de ni dus su yin no //
translated: That which is beyond the boundary for the sake of enjoyment is timely.

original: de las gzhan pa'i dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa'i rdzas blang ba yang yin par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir phyogs dang bcas pa yin no //
analyzed: de las gzhan pa'i dge slong rnams kyis rnyed pa'i rdzas blang ba yang yin par yang dag par bstan pa'i phyir phyogs dang bcas pa yin no //
translated: That which is taken as the property of other monks who are present is accompanied by a faction.

original: phyogs dang bcas pa des dge 'dun gyi dbyen du mi 'gyur ba'i phyir dge 'dun gyi dbyen dang bral ba yin te /

translated: In regard to a person who is overcome by pride and who wishes to conceal his own faults out of fear of being criticized, the companions in the celibate life, at a later time, in front of one, two, or many people,

original: gleng bar byed cing /🔽de la yang de gcig tu yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir lus kyis kyang yongs su gdung bar byed /
analyzed: gleng bar byed cing / de la yang de gcig tu yid du mi 'ong ba'i phyir lus kyis kyang yongs su gdung bar byed /
translated: and he speaks about it.

original: sems kyis kyang yongs su gdung bar byed de /
analyzed: sems kyis kyang yongs su gdung bar byed de /
translated: Because of that, he is tormented by his body and tormented by his mind.🔽He thinks, “It is not right for me to disparage myself in the presence of others because I have been overcome by pride.”

original: de ltar nga rgyal gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa'i phyir gzhan dag gi mdun du bdag la smod par byed na mi rung ngo snyam pa de ni yongs su gdung ba yin la ltung ba snga ma 'chab pa ni 'chab pa yin te /
analyzed: de ltar nga rgyal gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa'i phyir gzhan dag gi mdun du bdag la smod par byed na mi rung ngo snyam pa de ni yongs su gdung ba yin la ltung ba snga ma 'chab pa ni 'chab pa yin te /
translated: That is his torment. He conceals the previous downfall. That is his concealment.

original: de ltar nga rgyal gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa'i phyir rang gi nyes pa de 'chab par 'dod pa de gnyis ka yang rtsod pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
analyzed: de ltar nga rgyal gyis mngon par tshar bcad pa'i phyir rang gi nyes pa de 'chab par 'dod pa de gnyis ka yang rtsod pa'i rtsa ba yin no //
translated: Because he has been overcome by pride, he wants to conceal his faults. Both of those are roots of disputes.

original: dge slong sgyu bag tu kun du spyod cing gzhan dag la yang brten pa'i rang bzhin can yin te /🔽'di lta ste /
analyzed: dge slong sgyu bag tu kun du spyod cing gzhan dag la yang brten pa'i rang bzhin can yin te / 'di lta ste /
translated: A monk who is deceitful and who is naturally dependent on others🔽knows that he will receive great offerings

original: @22a * // bsod nams che bar shes pa la rnyed pa'i phyir gus par byas te /
analyzed: @22a * // bsod nams che bar shes pa la rnyed pa'i phyir gus par byas te /
translated: and he is respectful.

original: bsnyen bkur byed la byams pas ma yin /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur byed la byams pas ma yin /
translated: It is not out of love for the one who serves.

original: gus pas ma yin /
analyzed: gus pas ma yin /
translated: It is not out of respect.

original: chos 'dod pas ma yin pa de yang yin no //
analyzed: chos 'dod pas ma yin pa de yang yin no //
translated: It is not out of a desire for the Dharma.

original: de bzhin du gnas sbyin pa'i slob dpon drang ba bzad pa'i rang bzhin can la ci 'dod pa bzhin gnas par bya zhing ;
analyzed: de bzhin du gnas sbyin pa'i slob dpon drang ba bzad pa'i rang bzhin can la ci 'dod pa bzhin gnas par bya zhing ;
translated: In the same way, it is when one accepts a teacher who gives a place to stay, who is honest and has a good character, and who lives as one wishes,

original: de nyid bdag gir byed par 'gyur ba bdag gis ni 'ga' yang bya mi dgos so snyam du brtags nas len par byed pa de yang yin no //
analyzed: de nyid bdag gir byed par 'gyur ba bdag gis ni 'ga' yang bya mi dgos so snyam du brtags nas len par byed pa de yang yin no //
translated: thinking, “I will not have to do anything at all, he will take care of everything.”

original: de bzhin du tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can bsod nams che la /
analyzed: de bzhin du tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa mkhas pa'i rang bzhin can bsod nams che la /
translated: In the same way, it is when one accepts a wise companion in the holy life who has great merit

original: dam pa'i chos la bsnyen bkur bya ba dag 'phral gyi bya ba gzhan dag la bdag nyid snying las chung ngur gnas shing /
analyzed: dam pa'i chos la bsnyen bkur bya ba dag 'phral gyi bya ba gzhan dag la bdag nyid snying las chung ngur gnas shing /
translated: and who is worthy of the service of the holy Dharma, thinking, “I will live with few concerns,

original: de thams cad byed par 'gyur ro snyam du brtags nas grogs su len par byed pa yang de yin no //
analyzed: de thams cad byed par 'gyur ro snyam du brtags nas grogs su len par byed pa yang de yin no //
translated: and he will do everything.”

original: de bzhin du ltung ba byung yang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis bskul zhing dris na gzhan dang gzhan du bsgyur zhing smra bar byed pa yang yin te /
analyzed: de bzhin du ltung ba byung yang tshangs pa mtshungs par spyod pa dag gis bskul zhing dris na gzhan dang gzhan du bsgyur zhing smra bar byed pa yang yin te /
translated: Likewise, when a transgression has occurred, he does not deceive and mislead the fellow practitioners of pure conduct by evasive and ambiguous statements when they admonish and question him.

original: sgyu bag tu spyod pa sgyu dang g-yo la gnas pa ni gzhi des rtsod par 'gyur te /
analyzed: sgyu bag tu spyod pa sgyu dang g-yo la gnas pa ni gzhi des rtsod par 'gyur te /
translated: He who practices with deceit and pretense, who is full of deceit and pretense, will dispute with others on the basis of that.

original: lhag ma ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The rest should be understood as appropriate.

original: de las bzlog pa'i chos lnga ni ma dad pa rnams dad pa dang / dad pa rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: de las bzlog pa'i chos lnga ni ma dad pa rnams dad pa dang / dad pa rnams 'phel bar 'gyur ba yin par rig par bya'o //
translated: The five qualities that are the opposite of those should be understood as the ones that cause the faithful to increase in faith and the faithless to acquire faith.

original: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa thams cad du phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
analyzed: dge slong 'dul ba'i bslab pa la brtson pa'i stobs lnga dang ldan pa'i yang dag pa'i sbyor ba ni rnam pa thams cad du phun sum tshogs pa yin par rig par bya ste /
translated: The monk who is engaged in the training of the Vinaya and who possesses the five powers of application is perfectly endowed in every way.

original: lnga gang zhe na /
analyzed: lnga gang zhe na /
translated: What are the five?

original: sbyor ba'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / rtogs pa'i stobs dang / shes pa'i stobs dang / gnas pa'i stobs so //
analyzed: sbyor ba'i stobs dang / bsam pa'i stobs dang / rtogs pa'i stobs dang / shes pa'i stobs dang / gnas pa'i stobs so //
translated: The power of application, the power of thought, the power of realization, the power of knowledge, and the power of abiding.

original: bslab pa 'dod pa kho nas snying thag pa nas bslab pa thams cad la mchog tu gus pas bdag nyid dul bar bya ba dang / bdag nyid zhi bar bya ba dang / bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir slob par byed pa de ni sbyor ba'i stobs yin no //
analyzed: bslab pa 'dod pa kho nas snying thag pa nas bslab pa thams cad la mchog tu gus pas bdag nyid dul bar bya ba dang / bdag nyid zhi bar bya ba dang / bdag nyid yongs su mya ngan las 'da' bar bya ba'i phyir slob par byed pa de ni sbyor ba'i stobs yin no //
translated: The power of application is when, with a desire for training alone, one trains with supreme respect for all the trainings, from the depths of one's heart, in order to tame oneself, pacify oneself, and attain complete nirvana.

original: ltung ba byung ba na bsam pa thag pas slong bar byed pa de ni bsam pa'i stobs yin no ;
analyzed: ltung ba byung ba na bsam pa thag pas slong bar byed pa de ni bsam pa'i stobs yin no ;
translated: The power of attitude is when, if one has a downfall, one confesses it with a sincere attitude.

original: / stobs lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
analyzed: / stobs lhag ma rnams ni ci rigs par rig par bya'o //
translated: The remaining powers should be understood as appropriate.

original: 'dul ba ma mo rdzogs te /
analyzed: 'dul ba ma mo rdzogs te /
translated: The Vinaya Mātṛkā is complete.

original: 'dul ba bsdu ba rdzogs so /
analyzed: 'dul ba bsdu ba rdzogs so /
translated: The Vinaya Compendium is complete.

original: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a war ma dang / dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
analyzed: // / rgya gar gyi mkhan po pra dzny'a war ma dang / dzi na mi tra dang / zhu chen gyi lo ts'a ba ban de ye shes sde la sogs pas bsgyur cing zhus te gtan la phab pa /
